results.text: Caster explodes and is instantly dropped to zero stamina. Everyone adjacent to them takes 10 explosion damage.
Caster loses 1d4 stamina permanently.
Until their next rest, the caster’s stamina cannot go any higher than it is right now. Even if they win a battle, increase their max stamina or heal.
Caster’s weapon degrades and permanently deals 1 less damage per hit.

A flaming trident appears in the caster’s hand and can be used as a weapon. Deals 8 fire damage to foes. Inflicts a Burn on an [18] or higher.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A flamethrower appears in the caster’s hands. Deals 4 fire damage in a 15 foot cone extending out from the wielder. Hits multiple targets at once.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A spiked icicle blade appears in the caster’s hand and can be used as a weapon. Deals 8 ice damage to foes. Instantly freezes wet targets.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.

A series of ice-cold metal throwing star snowflakes appear in the caster’s hand. They can be thrown up to 30ft away and deal 5 ice damage on hit. The snowflakes pierce all physical defenses. Unlimited ammo.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
An electrified taser appears in the caster’s hand and can be used as a weapon. Deals 2 electric damage to foes. Stuns foes on a [12] or higher.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.

A static charge gun appears in the caster’s hand. Deals 3 electric damage at 30ft. Damage is increased by +1 for every 5ft the wielder moves before firing. Damage resets at the start of the welder's turn.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A thorny whip made out of a vine appears in the caster’s hand and can be used as a weapon. Deals 7 plant damage to foes. 10ft range.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A seed slingshot appears in the caster’s hands. Fires seeds that instantly bloom into a 1x1 square of any kind of plant you want. Deals 3 plant damage.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
An oversized fan appears in the caster’s hands. Deals 4 wind damage. On a successful hit, targets can be pushed back up to 10 feet.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A leaf blower appears in the caster’s hands. Deals 3 wind damage in a 15ft cone. Can be used as a jetpack to glide up to 15ft in any direction once per combat.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A heavy quartz club made of gemstones appears in the caster’s hand. Deals 10 earth damage, but it’s extremely heavy. Only hits on a [9] or higher.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.

A bejeweled crossbow appears in the caster’s hands. Deals 7 earth damage. On a [15] or higher, targets can be mesmerized by the sparkly gemstone bolts that land nearby. Bolts that hit targets can’t mesmerize.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.

An oversized citric lollipop appears in the caster’s hand. Deals 6 acid damage to foes. On rolls of [15] or higher the sourness shuts a target’s mouth tight and prevents them from eating any consumables for 3 rounds.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.

A lemonade blaster appears in the caster’s hand. This water gun filled with lemonade deals 4 acid damage at 25ft. Makes targets sticky and reduces their movement by 5ft for a turn. This status can stack.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
Roll for wild magic again, only this time the target of the spell is reversed: If the spell affects the “target” it now affects the caster and vice versa.
A dripping wet pool noodle appears in the caster’s hand. Deals 4 water damage. Has 10ft reach and can hit two adjacent targets in one swing.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.

A seltzer bottle appears in the caster’s hands. Deals 5 water damage at 20ft. This weapon is hilarious! Causes onlookers to burst into laughing fits on rolls of [18] or higher. Laughing targets cannot attack for one round and must roll to break the laughing fit at the start of each turn. Otherwise they will remember how funny the joke is and start laughing all over again.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A poisoned dagger appears in the caster’s hand. Deals 4 poison damage. Deals x3 damage upon successful, undetected sneak attacks.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
An extend-o-biter appears in the caster’s head. This snake-head-on-a-stick can bite foes up to 15ft away for 6 poison damage. Wielder can use this to grab small items from a distance.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A shadow scythe appears in the caster’s hands. Deals 7 darkness damage. Crits on both a 19 and a 20. Can be stored in the wielder's shadow.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A cursed bow and arrow appears in the caster’s hands. Can deal 5 darkness damage within 50ft, OR fire a cursed arrowhead that explodes and cloaks a 3x3 area into complete darkness for 3 rounds.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A neon saber appears in the caster’s hands. Deals 6 light damage and illuminates a 30ft area around the wielder like a torch.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A box of flash grenades appears on the caster’s person. Each deals 2 damage to a 3x3 grid and blinds all targets within for one round. Range 25ft.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A pair of ringing cymbals appear in the caster’s hands. Smash them against a target to deal 6 sonic damage. Deals 3 sonic damage to adjacent targets.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.

A loud megaphone appears in the caster’s hand. This megaphone projects your voice over a huge distance. You can hit any single target for 5 sonic damage. The megaphone has a 250ft range. Can be used for communication.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
An aerogel warhammer appears in the caster’s hand. It’s incredibly light and swings fast. +2 bonus to attack rolls. Deals 7 damage to a single target.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A hard-light boxing glove appears on the caster’s hand. Punch to send a phantom fist up to 30ft away and hit a target for 6 force damage. Can also be used as a melee-range weapon.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A rusty chainsaw appears in the caster’s hands. Deals 8 metal grinding damage to one target. Roll advantage when attacking inanimate obstacles.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.

A nail gun appears in the caster’s hand. Fire up to three nails per round dealing 2 damage each at 30ft. Roll a d20+2 for each nail fired. Nails can be aimed at multiple targets provided they are within 15ft of each other. If all three nails hit a single target, they become trapped against an adjacent surface.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.
A lycan gauntlet appears in the caster’s hand. The wielder can track any target’s scene for 24 hours after they have been scratched by the wolf claws on this bladed gauntlet. Deals 5 faunal damage.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.

A cuckoo nest appears on the caster’s head. The nest contains three birds loyal to the caster. The birds can dive bomb and attack anyone within 25ft, dealing 2 faunal damage each (OR) the birds can fly around a target’s head instead of attacking, which inflicts confusion on rolls of [13] or higher.
A rainbow impossi-blade appears in the caster’s hands. Changes shape to reflect the soul of the wielder. Deals 7 points of pure magic damage.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.

A dream wand appears in the caster’s hands. Shoots pure magical blasts dealing 5 damage at 25ft. This wand can be aimed at a target to summon a small item that the target loves, but only if the wand has never attacked them.
Same as the above, but it appears in the target’s hand instead of the caster’s.

A fix-it wrench appears in the caster’s hands. This wrench can immediately fix any broken aspect of something so long as the target being fixed occupies a 1x1 square. This includes sentient creatures. The wrench has 10 uses. Each individual ailment counts as a single use. One swing of the wrench can heal 5 stamina, mend a wound, cure an illness, remove a status ailment, or repair an object. After 10 uses, the wrench becomes a normal wrench.
Same as the above, except the wrench appears in the target’s hands.
Caster now has a one-time use skeleton key. They can open absolutely any door with it one time, no questions asked. Metaphorical doors do not count.
Target is poisoned. They take 2 damage at the start of each turn. Lasts 5 rounds.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target is badly poisoned. Take 2 damage at the start of the first turn, 3 damage at the start of the turn after that, 4 damage at the start of the following turn, and so on. Poison dissipates when the target is knocked out or when combat ends.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target is bleeding. Target suffers 3 damage each time they physically exert themselves during a standard action. A character can avoid damage from this status, but only if they abstain from attacking/using abilities. The effect can be cured by any type of magical or professional healing, but not through consumables.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
Target has a splinter. For each 5ft they move, they take 1 damage.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target is burnt. Caster chooses a location to burn the target. The target takes 2 damage any time said wound area is touched or moved. If they are attacked here, they take 2 extra damage in addition to any regular attack damage.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target is lit aflame. They take 3 damage at the start of every turn until the fire is put out. This fire spreads to any living targets touched by the afflicted. Once a person has been doused once, they cannot be hit by this effect again.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
Target is nauseous. They cannot consume items for the rest of the day.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target is stinky. They cannot assist with combined actions or stand adjacent to their allies. They are too smelly! Nobody wants to be near them. This effect lasts until they find a way to remove the smell.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
Target is made mundane. They cannot use their Epithet or cast any magic for the next five rounds.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
Target becomes forgetful. They are unable to use any abilities on their character sheet for the next two rounds.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target has butterfingers. For the next ten minutes, they cannot use items, including weapons. If they attempt to use any item, they must roll with triple disadvantage. A failed roll drops the item, wasting their action.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
A nearby object or floor tile comes to life and entangles the target. They are stuck in place and cannot move until freed.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target goes berserk. Target gains a +3 boost to all attack and damage rolls, but everyone nearby now appears as enemies to the target and they are inclined to attack the closest one. Lasts for five rounds or until the target is knocked out or otherwise pacified.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
A spotlight appears on the target. All nearby enemy combatants are forced to attack them and only them for the next round.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
The target is marked for death. All combatants attempting to attack the target now roll with a +3 on all their attack rolls for the next 2 rounds.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
The target becomes unlucky. Attacks directed at the affected target will now be critical hits on 17-20 for the next five rounds.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
For the next ten minutes, the target is doomed. Critical hits on this target now deal x3 damage instead of x2.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
Target suddenly feels fragile. Character takes an additional +2 damage from all physical attacks for the next five rounds.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target is confused. Whenever they attempt an action, they must roll a 1d4. If they roll a 1, instead of using their intended action they will use a random other ability, weapon, or item decided by their enemies.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
Target is completely brainwashed and the caster gains full control over them for the next two rounds. Only works for one round on bosses. Caster does not have access to their character sheet.
Same as the above, but the affliction is reversed between caster and target.

Target is charmed. Target is smitten by the caster and they are compelled to listen to their requests in order to gain their favor. The caster has advantage when convincing the target to do things. Asking for outrageous things (i.e. attacking allies outright) may be enough to break the charm, depending on its power. Lasts for an hour or until broken.
Same as the above, but the affliction is reversed.
Target is now afraid of the caster and must roll a fear check to even approach them. Lasts for five rounds.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target is exhausted. Using abilities costs the target progressively more stamina with each ability. The first ability costs only 1 no matter its usual cost, the second costs 2, and so on. There is no cap on this. The effect goes away the next time they sleep or the next time combat ends.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
For the rest of the combat, the target is antsy. Their first action for the rest of combat MUST be moving at least 20ft away from where they are standing at the start of their turn.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target is asleep and cannot move or act. Target restores +3 stamina at the start of every turn they are still asleep. Will wake up if attacked. The target can choose to stay asleep or roll a [16] or higher to wake up.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
For the next turn, the target is stunned. They can either move OR act this turn, but not both.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target is knocked prone. They must spend either a move action or a standard action to stand up. Until then, all incoming attacks get +3 to their attack rolls and all of the target’s attacks have a -4 modifier applied to them.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
Target is now drunk and takes a debuff. If the target has a large build, -1 to all rolls. If they have a medium build -2, if they have a svelte build, -4. This effect lasts for the next hour.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target is frozen in ice. They are completely trapped. Can be melted by fire or broken by force. The ice has 30 points of health. They may attack the ice from the inside as best they can. Fire attacks deal x3 damage to the ice.

Target is petrified and turned to stone. They have -5 damage reduction from all physical attacks, but cannot move. Lasts for five rounds. The petrification can be cured if the afflicted’s allies give them three standard action’s worth of massages. Massage turns can be split between allies. Doesn’t work on bosses, reroll the spell.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target is stopped in time, but still conscious. Lasts 3 rounds. For each turn they are stopped, the target will write down a prepared action for what they WOULD have done if they could have acted in that moment. When time resumes, they will use all their prepared actions right in a row. If the target took any damage while stopped, they will perform their actions first, then take the damage at the end. Up to the GM if this works on bosses.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
Roll for wild magic again, only this time the target of the spell is reversed: If the spell affects the “target” it now affects the caster and vice versa.

Target is slowed. They move at half speed (rounded up). Roll with disadvantage on all checks that require dexterity or speed, including attack rolls. Lasts for three rounds. Only lasts for two rounds on a boss.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
Target is hasted. They move and act twice per turn. Lasts three rounds. Only lasts for one round on a boss.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.

Target becomes a poltergeist. They may assist their allies, but only indirectly by messing with the surrounding arena like a ghost moving props around. While they are a poltergeist they are invisible, movement is tripled, and they cannot take damage from anything that can’t attack ghosts. However, they cannot deal damage either. After 3 rounds they will revert back to their previous location. They cannot take damage during this time but using abilities still costs stamina.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
Target is electrified for five rounds. Any physical contact results in 4 electrical damage. Hitting them with a weapon only counts as “contact” if the weapon is metallic or another kind of conductor.
Same as the above, but the affliction is applied to the caster.
Caster is immune to status ailments for the next ten minutes.
Any attempts to afflict the target with a status ailment roll with advantage for the rest of the day.
Caster rolls a d20. Look at the number they rolled. That number now counts as a second nat20 critical success for them for the rest of the day. If they rolled a 20, tough luck.
Caster rolls a d20. Look at the number they rolled. That number now counts as a second nat20 critical success for everyone for the rest of the day. If they rolled a 20, tough luck.
Target rolls a d20. Look at the number they rolled. That number now counts as a second nat1 critical failure for the target for the rest of the day. If they rolled a 1, good for them.
Target rolls a d20. Look at the number they rolled. That number now counts as a second nat1 critical failure for all of their allies for the rest of the day. If they rolled a 1, good for them.
The next time the target rolls a 20, it turns into a 15 instead.
Caster has a saved nat 20 to use in place of any roll of theirs that they choose. They must choose to use the saved nat 20 BEFORE the roll they wish to replace.
The next time the target rolls a 1-5, it automatically counts as a crit fail.
Caster now has a saved nat 1 to use to replace any roll of their choosing. Works on anyone’s roll. They must choose to use the saved nat1 BEFORE the roll they wish to replace.

For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [1] is now a proud parent! A fragile bag of flour with a baby face drawn on it appears in your arms. If the flour bag is damaged at all, it instantly explodes and the parent takes 10 damage. This effect stacks for multiple babies.

For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [2] doubles in width. They take up a 2x1 spot on the battlemap instead of a 1x1. If they roll another 2 then they may either choose to reduce the effect or double width again (4x1 or 2x2, your choice). This effect continues to stack. Wide targets to not get stronger. The only mechanical change is their attack range and target size.

For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [3] is immediately surrounded on all adjacent tiles by a crowd of sarcastically applauding jerks until the end of their next turn. The jerks cannot be bypassed. If anyone is occupying an adjacent tile, the jerks immediately push them out of the way.

For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [4] sprouts thorny spikes wherever they walk, creating floor hazards that last until this effect is over. Walking over the thorns deals 3 damage per thorn tile.
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [5] must instantly trade places with someone else in their line of sight. The person who rolled the 5 picks.
For the next 5 minutes, all [6] rolls immediately flip upside-down into a [9].
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [7] may choose to treat it as a [20].
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls an [8] briefly glimpses into infinity. They learn a random piece of info on a nearby target’s character sheet.
For the next 5 minutes, all [9] rolls immediately flip upside-down into a [6].
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [10] on the d20 must reroll their die. Get something more polarizing!
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls an [11] gains bouncy shoes and can jump at twice their usual height until the effect ends.
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [12] automatically dodges the next attack aimed towards them. Only grants one use. This does not stack.
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [13] tastes soup in their mouth and instantly restores 5 points of Stamina.
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [14] gains the power to effortlessly climb any object of their choice. Lasts until the effect ends.

For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [15] glows with a blinding light. No one can look directly at them. Attackers roll with disadvantage. Only one target can glow at a time. If someone else rolls a 15, they steal the glow. If a glowing target rolls another 15, their glow turns off like a light switch.

For the next 5 minutes, any time someone rolls a [16] a hat appears on their head. The hat is in any style of their choosing. The hats do not disappear after the 5 minutes end. You may gain multiple hats.
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [17] grows two feet in height. Lasts until the effect ends. This ability can stack.
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls an [18] becomes elastic and can stretch their limbs up to 10ft away. Lasts until the effect ends.
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [19] adds +3 damage to their current action if it’s damaging. Only applies once per 19.
For the next 5 minutes, anyone who rolls a [20] doubles any usual proficiency gains they would earn from critical rolls.

For the next five rounds, everyone's dice are replaced with a deck of cards. Cards worth 2 through 10 directly correspond to their usual dice roll number. A jack is a [13]. A queen is [16]. A king is a [19]. The caster gets to decide if any aces drawn are counted as high (20) or low (1).

For the next five rounds, the target’s dice are replaced with a deck of cards. Success is determined by the suit. Spades are a total success (like a [16]), Hearts are a success (like a [12]), Clubs are a partial success (like a [6]), and Diamonds are a catastrophic failure (like a [1]).

For the next three rounds, the target’s dice are replaced with a coin flip. They must call heads or tails before the flip. If they call successfully, their roll succeeds as if they had rolled a [15]. If not, they fail as if they had rolled a [3].
For the rest of the day if the caster readies an action, they will charge up their power for every turn that goes by until their action goes off. +1 damage for each combatant that moves before you.
Target gains a -5 debuff to all combined actions for the next ten minutes.
Caster gains +5 to all combined actions for the next hour.
Target cannot participate in combined actions for the rest of the day.
Caster can participate in as many combined actions as they want per turn with no limits for the next ten minutes.
Target lays an egg.
Target has the irresistible urge to eat their weapon. Lasts for five minutes, until combat ends, or until the weapon is eaten.

Target is transformed into an animal that seems oddly appropriate for them for the next five minutes. They can still use their skills and/or epithet provided it makes sense as their animal. They can talk and understand speech.

A terrible assassin has spawned somewhere and will attempt to kill the caster at some point during this adventure. But they’re like… REALLY bad at it. The assassin may turn out to be a character the players are familiar with.

Target falls in love with the person closest to them for one hour. If either person involved is a minor, instead of falling in love the target feels they have to protect the other person no matter what.

Target falls in love with the person furthest from them for one hour. If either person involved is a minor, instead of falling in love the target feels they have to protect the other person no matter what.
Target falls in love with the caster for one hour. If either person involved is a minor, instead of falling in love the target feels they have to protect the other person no matter what.
Target falls madly in love with the nearest inanimate object.
Target suddenly believes the biggest threat to them at the moment has a crush on them.
Target feels compelled to give a passionate speech about one of their favorite subjects instead of acting on their next turn.
Target speaks only in rhyme for the next hour. Every time they fail to speak in rhyme, they take 5 damage.

Caster and target must have a conversation while speaking in alternating rhyme. Each sentence ends with the same rhyme (i.e. Go, blow, snow). Whoever fails to come up with a rhyme first will burst into flame, taking 5 damage at the start of each turn until the fire is put out.
Target speaks backwards for the next ten minutes.
Target suspects that random inanimate objects are speaking behind their back for the next 24 hours. …Maybe they are.

Ripples of force continuously push out from both the caster and target, making it impossible to get within 5ft of them for the next three rounds. If they meet, both of them will implode, taking 12 points of force damage and ending the spell.
The target and one random object or person of the caster’s choice are attracted to each other like magnets.
The target and the caster are now handcuffed together. The key is hidden somewhere out of sight within 100ft.

Target is shaken by an earthquake that no one else can see or feel for three rounds. They must pass a DC [8] movement check each time they want to move, otherwise they will fall down and be knocked prone.

Target becomes a sentient sock puppet for 5 rounds. The target can still function as normal, but only if someone picks them up and wears them. Bosses will instead transform into a full-body puppet costume with legs.
Target is covered head to toe in glitter. The sparkling makes the target visible to anyone within line of sight until the glitter is removed. +2 to all attack rolls aimed at the target.

Target sneezes glitter. The target and anyone within a 15ft cone in front of them are now covered in glitter and are always visible to anyone within line of sight until the glitter is removed. +2 to attack rolls aimed at glittery targets.
Target is covered head to toe in a pile of spaghetti.
If the target didn’t move during their previous turn, they gain a magic shell over their back for one round that reduces incoming physical attack rolls by 2. This effect lasts the rest of the day.
Summon a clone of the target. This clone knows all of the target’s insecurities and will not stop mentioning them to people. The clone disappears after 5 minutes or when their double is KO’d.

Target’s shadow comes to life and begins attacking them. The shadow moves on their turn and has the same stats as the target, but takes double damage from light-based attacks. Shadow is dispelled after three rounds.
Target’s shadow has a task that it must complete and makes attempts to sneak off. If the shadow is separated from its body, the body takes double damage from any magic spells. Lasts for an hour.
If anyone steps on the target’s shadow, the target is unable to move. Lasts for the rest of the day.

For the rest of the day has a vampiric weakness to sunlight. Standing in direct sunlight will cause them to burst into flames. Re-entering the darkness will instantly douse the fire. Flames deal 5 fire damage when activated and 5 fire damage at the start of each turn the target is burning. Additionally, the target can no longer enter buildings without permission.

For the rest of the day, the target is a reverse vampire. They must always be near a source of light. If they are ever left in the dark, they will burst into flame, dealing 5 darkness damage when activated and 5 damage at the start of every turn the target remains in darkness. Additionally, the target can enter any building without permission. All doors unlock for them.
Target loses their sense of taste for a day.
Target loses their sense of smell for a day.
Target cannot read for the rest of the day.
Target is struck blind for three rounds. Roll disadvantage on all attack rolls and any actions that require vision, including movement on difficult terrain.
Target is deafened for five rounds. Attack rolls aimed at the target from behind roll with advantage.
Target generates no sound for five rounds no matter what they do. +10 to any stealth checks and sneak attacks they make.
Target loses object permanence for 15 minutes.
Target loses their sensation of touch for 5 minutes. They cannot feel attacks, but still take damage from them.

Target’s sensation of pain is reversed for the rest of the day. The less damage they take, the more dramatically they react to the wound. 10 damage feels like nothing while 1 damage feels like searing, screaming pain. Mechanically, they still take damage as normal.

Target gains inverse strength for the next hour. Objects that are normally easy to lift like feathers become immovable while extremely heavy and cumbersome objects like pianos can suddenly be lifted with ease. Any clothes or armor the target is wearing are not affected, but items they are holding are.

Target is now immune to all types of poisons for the rest of the day (i.e. dish soap, acetone, paint thinner, actual poison). However, the target is EXTREMELY curious what these items taste like and will prioritize taste-testing them above all else the moment they are spotted.
Target begins sweating literal bullets.
Target is compelled to reveal a secret.

The next object the target steps on will cause them to slip cartoonishly, as though they just walked over a banana peel. Slipping ends the target’s movement and knocks them prone. They must spend either a move action or a standard action to stand up. Until then, all incoming attacks get +3 to their attack rolls and all of the target’s attacks have a -4 modifier applied to them.
A dozen doves burst out of the target’s sleeves.
The next time this target shouts or yells, an entire swarm of bees emerges from their mouth. Surprise!
All of the target’s weapons turn into a 3x3 swarm of bees for the next three rounds. The bees are nobody’s friend and deal 3 sting damage to anyone caught in the swarm at the start of their turn.
The target’s weapon superheats for three rounds. They must drop the weapon or take 9 fire damage at the start of each round that they hold it.
The nearest door now has an attitude. It is rude and passing through it becomes a problem. Lasts for one hour.
Caster can perfectly imitate any sounds/voices of their choosing for one hour.
For the next 10 minutes, the target will answer any questions directed at them with complete honesty. Whether they want to or not.

The digits of the target’s max stamina pool are swapped for the duration of the combat (ex: 41 → 14). If the swap lowers their max stamina beneath their current amount, their current stamina is reduced to the new max. If their max stamina increases, they do not gain more stamina, but may heal in order to recover it. This spell only works if the target has two digits worth of stamina. If they have 1 or 3 digits OR  if they are a boss, reroll a different wild magic spell.

Target’s hair grows long and gorgeous, so much so that it becomes difficult to deal with. Target’s attack rolls are reduced by 1 and their movement is reduced by 5ft until the hair is cut. However, the hair grants +5 to any charm/diplomacy checks.

Target is now wearing a distractingly colorful hat. They cannot take it off for 5 hours. They get a +5 to all charm/diplomacy checks while wearing the hat, but they are always visible to those within 100ft. The hat pokes around corners.
Roll for wild magic again, only this time the target of the spell is reversed: If the spell affects the “target” it now affects the caster and vice versa.

Target’s soul switches bodies with another creature of the caster’s choosing for the next five minutes or until one of them is knocked out. Souls keep their epithets, abilities, and stamina with them, but inventories/items do not swap.

A line of ducklings appear and mistake the caster for their mother, following them everywhere. The ducklings’ actual mother is now hidden somewhere in the campaign. You must locate her to remove the ducklings. This spell summons one duckling for every 5 points of max stamina the caster has. If the ducklings are damaged, they will run away and the caster will take 5 damage for each duckling that gets hurt. If a duckling is hit for a single point of damage, it will vanish. If all the ducklings are returned safely, the caster is rewarded with 5 points of proficiency.
Target’s hands and feet are now covered in wet cement. The cement will dry after two rounds, rendering their limbs imobile unless removed.
Target can now seamlessly climb walls and ceilings like a spider for the next half hour.
A salesman appears and is absolutely determined to sell something to the target. They can be haggled with, but will not leave until the sale is complete.

Target becomes convinced that they are secretly a robot. What’s more, they are convinced that everyone else suspects they are a robot. They must keep their secret at all costs. If anyone accuses them of being a robot with reasonable evidence, they take 15 electrical damage. This effect ends the next time the target sleeps or after they have been successfully accused.
Target’s clothes begin to scream swears nonstop for the next ten minutes.

The shadow of a falling object appears over the target and continues growing in size. The shadow follows them wherever they go. Whatever is falling will hit them in 1d6 rounds. Only the GM knows the result of the 1d6 roll. Whatever is falling increases in both size and damage output the longer it takes to fall. Others may be crushed under the falling object if it’s big enough.

Target must incorporate a randomly selected word into every sentence that they say for the next hour. The caster selects the word. Each sentence must make sense and contain the specified word, otherwise the target cannot speak it. The selected word can be no longer than two syllables.
All of the target’s limbs become detachable until the next time they fall asleep.
Target is convinced they are invincible until the end of combat. They are not.
A random limb on the target’s body turns to gold for 1 hour. Caster picks the limb.
All glass within 50ft of the target turns into solid gold.
All glass within 250ft of the caster is fogged up and cannot be seen through for five rounds.
Target can fly in any direction unhindered at 60ft per round. Lasts 10 minutes.
Every living creature within 25ft of the caster sprouts wings and can fly for 10 minutes.

Target now has a harmless hole through their torso, like a cartoon shot with a cannonball. The hole disappears the next time they sleep. If anyone fills the hole with another material (i.e. stone, cheese, etc) then the target will turn into a statue made of that material for ten minutes before returning to normal.
Target is now holding a freshly-baked pie. Pie restores 15 stamina. The 15 stamina can be shared among others so long as they are adjacent.

DO NOT READ THIS ALOUD. All combatants are suddenly holding a delicious-looking slice of cake! Yay! Most of the slices heal 5 stamina. …However, unbeknownst to the players one of the slices is poisoned and will deal 15 damage when consumed. The poisoned slice is determined by a secret GM roll.

For the next ten minutes, the target is trapped at their current elevation. They cannot climb, jump, or descend in any way. However, they can walk straight across chasms, gaps, and water while being unaffected by gravity.

Target is convinced they are in a musical. All their dialogue must be sung for the next 5 minutes in-universe. They take 1 point of damage for every word not sung. The player/GM controlling them must also sing and the same rule applies to them, even when speaking out-of-character.

Everyone within 500 feet is convinced they are in a musical. All their dialogue must be sung for the next 5 minutes in-universe. They take 1 point of damage for every word not sung. Their players and the GM must also sing.
For the next 10 minutes, random words of the target’s sentences are bleeped out as if they are swears, whether or not the target is actually swearing.

The GM begins narrating the target’s actions like the target is an animal being filmed in a nature documentary. The players can control the target by chiming in and narrating their actions, but each player only gets to do this once and it only works if they do the voice. If two players attempt to do this at the same time, they both lose their chance. This effect lasts for 10 minutes in-universe.

The GM begins narrating the target’s actions and thoughts from an omniscient 3rd person perspective, as though they are being narrated in an audiobook. This is audible in-universe. The players can control the target by chiming in and narrating their actions, but each player only gets to do this once. If two players attempt to do this at the same time, they both lose their chance. Lasts for 10 minutes in-universe.

The target is going to take damage. Each of the players must close their eyes and begin counting in order, as a group. 1, 2, 3, 4, etc. The target will take as much damage as the players can count to. However, the moment more than one player both say a number, the count is over and the target takes the damage of the last number successfully read out. The players must use groupthink to count as high as they can without stepping on each other’s toes. No planning beforehand. The game starts the moment the GM finishes reading this. Go. (DO NOT READ THIS ALOUD: Max damage is 12. If the players reach higher than 12, give them all +1 proficiency.)
Target is suddenly naked. If they are underaged, they are instead covered head to toe in three additional layers of clothing.
Target’s pants fall down, revealing a pair of cartoon boxers with hearts on them. If the target is underaged, nothing happens and they are instead given a lollipop that restores 1 stamina.
A shooting star passes overhead. Everyone writes down a secret wish and the GM makes hidden rolls for each wish. If anyone’s wish rolls a 20, their wish will come true soon.

Target has a really annoying papercut on the tip of their finger. All their attack rolls have a -3 debuff and they take 1 damage every time they pick up or interact with an object until the wound is bandaged.
Target is now wanted by the local police for a crime determined by the GM. Incriminating evidence appears in their hands.
Caster turns invisible for up to five rounds. The invisibility is dispelled the first time they attack. Their first attack will be a sneak attack for x2 damage.
Target can now become invisible, but only to one person at a time. Successful attacks while invisible deal x2 damage. This ability lasts for ten rounds.
Target can turn invisible, but only while they are screaming. This ability lasts until the next time they fall asleep.
Target becomes slightly transparent for the next 15 minutes, like a ghost.
Target is now intangible. They are in full control of what does and doesn’t touch them. The target may walk through walls and objects. This lasts 1 minute outside of combat, two rounds during combat.

Target appears to be lagging. They randomly teleport here and there, clipping in and out of walls. The target rolls a d20 to determine how bad the lag is each turn with low rolls indicating worse lag. Attacks aimed at the target and coming from the target bother roll with disadvantage. A router appears in the arena somewhere. Anyone can reset it to end the effect.

Target is covered in a VHS effect. A VHS player appears somewhere in the area. By interacting with the VHS player, other combatants may fast forward, pause, rewind, and/or and eject the target. This effect lasts for ten rounds.
Caster can breathe underwater for the rest of the day.
Caster can walk on water for the rest of the day.

Target now has gills. Some part of them must be touching water for the rest of the day or they can’t breathe. Even a thimble of water is enough. Effect ends prematurely if they pass out. Does not work on bosses.
Target has an uncontrollable fear of a random animal of the caster’s choice until the end of the day.
A 5x5 trampoline appears beneath the target. Whee! It does not disappear.
Target is too short to ride. They are now under 3 ft tall. If the target was taller than 3ft, they are scrunched down vertically and look like a badly edited image. This effect lasts for 30 minutes.

A rain cloud appears above the target's head and rains on them wherever they go. The rain cloud will automatically move to cover whoever the saddest person in the room is. Cloud dissipates after 30 minutes.

For the rest of the day, whenever the target has an interaction with another person, there is a green smiley face or red frowny face floating above the target’s head showing how they really feel about the person they’re talking to.
A life-sized statue of the target appears nearby, made of cheese. Every time someone bites the statue, the target will take damage as if they were bit.
Sincerity Curse. The Player/GM must give every other player at the table a genuine compliment. If they fail to do this, the target is instantly knocked out.

Confidence Curse. The target is forced to genuinely compliment something they like about themselves at the start of each of their turns in combat. If they cannot think of something they like about themselves and share it within 30 seconds, they lose their upcoming turn.
The target’s toes and fingers switch places for the next half hour. They roll with disadvantage when handling items or swinging their weapon… but they can pick stuff up with their feet now!

Target literally has two left feet for the rest of the day. They must roll a DC8 movement check any time they move more than 15ft in a single round. If they fail, they trip and their movement ends. Attempts to dance fail automatically.
The caster gains the skills of a contortionist for a day. They can now bend in unusual ways, escape handcuffs, and harmlessly dislocate bones.
For the next hour, the caster has the elasticity of an octopus. They can squeeze through any space so long as it’s larger than their nose.
For the next five minutes, anything the caster draws will come to life.
No one can remember the target’s name for the next 24 hours, no matter how hard they try.

Everyone gets the target’s name just a little bit wrong for the next 24 hours. Each person referring to them (players included) must refer to them by name and they must get the name wrong every time. No two misnomers may be the same. The first person to reuse a name takes 15 damage, after which the effect will end.
Object permanence invisibility. For the rest of the day, if the caster ever leaves the target’s sight, the target will completely forget that the caster exists.
For 24 hours, the target’s health bar is visible to everyone in-universe.

Gravity reverses for the target. If they are indoors, they suddenly fall to the ceiling. If there is no ceiling above them then they fall into the sky and respawn on the floor as if they hit a kill plane in a video game, taking 10 damage. The effect ends in five rounds or after they hit the kill plane.
Target begins floating higher and higher, five feet each turn. Effect ends when they are knocked out or when they surrender in battle. (Does not work on bosses. Reroll wild magic instead.)
For the next 10 minutes, the target is only partially affected by gravity. They can jump five times as high and hang in the air.
For the next 10 minutes, all combatants are only partially affected by gravity. They can jump five times as high and hang in the air.

Whatever room the target is currently in slowly begins rotating clockwise, about 30 degrees every round, affecting all creatures and objects not nailed down. This effect ends when combat ends or after one complete rotation. If you are currently outdoors, reroll.

The target’s stamina is replaced by 8-bit video game health hearts. Taking damage from ANY source removes one heart, no matter how powerful or weak the attack is. Target gains one heart for every 10 points of remaining stamina (rounded up, i.e. 11 stamina = 2 hearts), minimum 3. When the hearts are depleted, the target is knocked out. (Does not work on bosses. Reroll wild magic instead.)

Target begins exploding like a 16-bit era video game death animation and has only three rounds to stop it before the animation completes and they are knocked out. A game console appears within 50ft of them. If they turn the console off, the animation stops. Anyone who touches the ongoing explosion animation takes 5 fire damage. GM decides whether or not this works on bosses.

A fighting game timer appears in-universe and begins counting down from 20 minutes in real-world time. If combat hasn’t ended by the time the timer reaches zero, whichever side has a higher percentage of their collective stamina remaining wins. The losing side is instantly knocked out.
Thought balloons appear above the target’s head and everyone can see exactly what they’re thinking for the next half hour.

The target’s mouth is now filled with coffee that they can only spit out if they are surprised or they find something funny. Whoever makes them do a spit take first gains control of them for two rounds.
Target becomes convinced that water is a deadly poison for the next 5 hours.

A frustrated genie appears and will grant the target one wish, but the genie is determined to do a bad job. The target does not know this. The target must make their wish immediately. Right now. Go. If they do not make their wish within the next 30 seconds, their stamina is instantly reduced to zero.
DO NOT READ THIS SPELL OUT LOUD. A glowing timer appears on the palm of the target’s hand and starts counting down. The GM decides what happens when this timer hits zero. Free reign.
A beautiful antique sports car appears and revs its engine. The target now legally owns this car.
A horse appears and whinnies. The target now legally owns this horse.

Target is surrounded by flies, giving the impression that they stink. Their allies refuse to interact with them in any way until the flies are removed. The flies stick around until they are all killed or one hour has passed.
A cockatiel rides in on a skateboard. The cockatiel is extremely cool. Whoever can impress the cockatiel first gains a +2 cool guy bonus to all rolls for the rest of the combat.
Target becomes the subject of a viral internet video some time today. Careful.
Target is instantly distracted by anything shiny for the next hour.
Target is convinced it is Halloween. Throwing together a costume so they can go trick or treating becomes their #1 priority.
Target becomes ugly for the remainder of the day. If the target thinks they are already ugly then they gain a permanent boost in self confidence and look exactly the same as they did before.
Target increases in size by one stage for three rounds. Normal targets now occupy a 2x2 square. Multiply their physical attack damage by 1.5x.
Target shrinks to a height of just a few inches for three rounds. Halve their physical attack damage and movement.
Roll a d20. The caster’s changes by a number of inches equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, they shrink. If the roll is even, they grow. Spell reverts the next time they sleep.

For the next 10 minutes loud, obnoxious polka music begins playing in the target’s head. They are the only one who can hear it. If they want to focus on something or prepare an action, they must pass a DC8 concentration check.
Caster’s skin now changes color based on their mood until the end of the day.

1d4 illusory doubles of the caster appear around them. The doubles occupy the same space as the caster. Attackers must succeed on a regular attack roll, then roll a luck check to see if they hit the intended target or a double. The luck check is a 1d(#doubles+ 1). Only rolling the max number on the luck check will land a hit, otherwise they will strike a double. Once a double has been hit, it is dispelled. AOE attacks can dispel multiple doubles. This spell ends after 10 minutes.
A 5x5 cloud of fog appears centered around the target and remains where it is for 10 minutes. All attack rolls in this fog have a -4 debuff to their accuracy.
A 3x3 cloud of fog appears centered around the target and follows them wherever they move for three rounds. All attacks in this fog have a -4 debuff to their accuracy.
A giant cat appears and begins cleaning the target with their tongue. They disappear when the target is clean. Removes all buffs and debuffs.
Flower petals flutter in the air within 10 feet of the caster for the next five minutes. They roll with triple advantage on any charm/diplomacy attempts.
Caster’s voice is now replaced by a bad 90s anime dub actor for 22 minutes.
Target goes through a complicated magical girl transformation. When it is finished, they are in a beautiful dress. This has no mechanical effects.

Target sees everyone as naked for the next ten minutes, but is too embarrassed to admit it. If they are looking at someone underaged then that person instead appears completely blacked out like a silhouette.

Prom is tomorrow! And the target needs to find a date! If they cannot find a date in the next two hours then they roll with a -5 loneliness debuff on all rolls for the rest of the day. If any of the combatants agree to be their date, that combatant gets +3 proficiency, but only provided they actually go on a date with the target.

Target must befriend someone within the next 10 minutes, otherwise any time they try to assist someone for the rest of the day their rolls have a -4 debuff. If one of the players decides to become their friend, that player will instantly gain two companionship points to spend however they like… provided they genuinely become the target’s friend.

Target must hold someone’s hand in the next 30 seconds otherwise they will not be able to hold anything for the next hour. If one of the players allows them to do this, that player will instantly gain two companionship points to spend however they like… provided they genuinely become the target’s friend.
Target finds $5 in their coat pocket.
Target finds $100 in their coat pocket.
Target finds $1000 in their coat pocket.
Target’s age changes to 10 years old for the next minute.
Roll for wild magic again, only this time the target of the spell is reversed: If the spell affects the “target” it now affects the caster and vice versa.
Target’s age changes to 65 years old for the next minute.
Target becomes trapped in a large 3x3 hamster ball.
A ghost begins following the target around… but it turns invisible whenever the target looks at it. Everyone else can see the ghost. Lasts until midnight.

For the rest of the day, the caster gains the ability to turn into stone as an anytime action once per combat. The target turns into stone for one round. The stone form reduces all incoming physical damage by 8. They can turn back from stone as a free action at the start of their turn.
For the next 24 hours the caster is able to cry big, cartoonish fountain jets of tears, but only when they are genuinely sad. These jets are strong enough to push targets up to 15ft away.
Target’s underwear is now made of metal. -5ft of movement.
Target’s entire outfit is now made of metal. -20ft of movement, subtract 3 from all physical attack rolls aimed at the target, but double the target’s vulnerability to electrical damage.
Target can sing like a fairytale princess in order to summon small, helpful animal friends for the rest of the day.
Caster can sing like a fairytale princess in order to summon small, helpful animal friends for the rest of the day.
Caster gains two vampire fangs. They can suck out small amounts of stamina from other targets as an unarmed attack. Lasts for the rest of the day.
Target strongly believes that they’re a talking, carnivorous dinosaur for the next ten minutes and acts accordingly.
Target gains a dragon tail for the rest of the day. Tail can be used like a whip as a weapon. Deals 6 damage with 10ft range.
Target gains a unicorn horn for the rest of the day. The horn shoots sparkles as an anytime action.
Target gains a prehensile monkey tail for the rest of the day.
Target gains a chameleon tongue that can shoot out 15ft and snag small items and prey. Effect lasts the rest of the day.
For 24 hours the caster can scale any vertical surface with the ease of a mountain goat so long as it has a slight slant and the angle is less than 90°.
Target gains the ability to juggle… but will lose it at an unfortunate time.
The caster can now create flames at will, but only a really tiny one at the tip of their finger, like a lighter. They lose this ability the next time they fall asleep.
Target can generate cool-looking black flames… but these flames only hurt the target. They lose this ability the next time they fall asleep.
Target is given a lovely bouquet of flowers from a secret admirer.
Target really needs to pee all of a sudden.
Wind repeatedly blows objects into the target’s face at the least opportune times for the rest of the day.

2d20 spaces immediately surrounding the target are filled with rakes that are liable to smack them in the face if they are stepped on. Each rake deals 2 damage when stepped on and immediately ends a target’s movement. Spaces filled start in the adjacent tile to the north of the target and wrap around them in a clockwise order.
Target changes into a giant, talking tree for the next five rounds. They occupy a 3x3 space but cannot move at all. Their abilities still function.

All combatants begin telling a story one word at a time, starting with the target and advancing along the turn order. Whatever happens in the story immediately happens to the target. Story is two sentences max.
Target gains a new fear of the caster’s choice (ex: heights, clowns, etc.)
Target must freestyle rap for 20 seconds about the situation at hand. If they refuse to even attempt this out of shyness, they instantly drop to 0 stamina.
Target can only call their allies by pet names along the lines of “hun” and “dear” for the next hour.
Target can only call their enemies by pet names along the lines of “hun”, “dear”, and sweetheart for the next hour.

A goblin in a dunce cap appears and insists on helping the target out, no matter what. However, the goblin is bad at everything and takes a -10 penalty on all of its rolls. Every time the goblin fails, somehow the failure will result in the target getting hurt. The goblin acts on the target’s turn. It has 5 stamina and deals 3 damage per attack. It disappears in a puff of smoke after ten minutes.

1d6 goblins suddenly come to the caster’s aid and act on the caster’s turn. However, they are deeply unskilled and roll with a -5 debuff on everything. Goblins deal 3 damage per hit and have 5 stamina a piece. They can move 20ft per turn. The goblins poof away into smoke after ten minutes.

A soda elemental appears and begins attacking the target and their allies. The soda elemental is made of bubbly sarsaparilla. It can move 25ft per round and strikes twice each turn, dealing 4 acid damage per strike. The soda elemental can be sipped to death at melee range provided an attacker can scoop some of it into a cup or suck it through a straw. For every 2 points of damage dealt to the elemental in this manner, the attacker restores 1 stamina.

A diretruck appears and comes to the aid of the caster and acts on the caster’s turn. The diretruck is a sentient, metal creature that resembles a firetruck and occupies a 3x2 square on the battlemap. The diretruck has 20 stamina, 8 movement, and can shoot acid from its fire hose up to 50ft away. The truck’s stamina is directly tied to its acid reserves. It costs 1 point of stamina to deal 1 point of acid damage. Once the diretruck’s acid reserves are used up, it will disappear.
There’s a bear now.
A horse appears and kicks you for 8 damage before running off.
A crab appears holding a remote detonator. You don’t know what it’s connected to.
An endangered bird lands on the target’s head. You are unable to move. If the bird is injured, whoever is at fault will be arrested by a magic park ranger.

A giant but completely benign squid appears in the area. Occupies 4x4 spaces. If anyone incurs the wrath of the squid, it will join the opposing side of the combat. The squid has 15ft reach and its tentacles deal 8 damage. The squid disappears after ten minutes.

A dead ancestor appears and challenges the target to a swordfight for their family’s honor. The ancestor is a ghost. They have 12 stamina and wield a ghostblade that deals 7 darkness damage per swing. The ghost takes half damage from all physical attacks but double damage from light attacks. Whoever slays the ancestor gets to keep their ghostblade.
One of the caster’s belongings has been replaced with a dangerous mimic that looks exactly like it.

The target suddenly has an insatiable craving for french fries. A basket of french fries appears in the caster’s hands. The target MUST consume the french fries. Attempting a non-french fry-related action means they roll with disadvantage until the fries are consumed. If someone else eats the fries, the target will go berserk, adding +3 to all attack rolls and damage output. They will always target the person nearest to them. The fries must be eaten and are otherwise indestructible. They are VERY good fries.

Little gun turrets appear on each of the caster’s shoulders. They automatically fire two bullets dealing 3 damage each to targets of the caster’s choice at the end of the caster’s turn. Lasts five rounds.

Caster is now carrying a big cartoon bomb with a lit wick. When the bomb explodes, it will deal 25 damage to whoever is holding it. The bomb will explode at the end of the caster’s turn in 1d3 rounds. Only the GM knows the result of this roll.
Target can only speak in short sentences exactly (1d8) words in length for the next ten minutes.

A sentient, evil camera begins following the target, snapping a picture at the end of their turn on every round. If the target’s entire body is captured in a photograph by the camera, they become Stopped in time for two rounds. The target can hide behind objects to prevent this effect. They are only Stopped if the camera captures their ENTIRE body in a photo.

Every single combatant is under the unshakable assumption that it is now the target’s birthday. Everyone else must give them a gift in the next minute. If you fail to give the target a gift you become one of their birthday candles and instantly light on fire, taking 8 fire damage at the start of each turn until the fire is doused.

For the rest of the day, the caster may claim “C’mon, it’s my birthday!!!” once per round as an anytime action. This claim can be used to stop incoming attacks or convince nearby combatants to do something. It is not the target’s birthday. NOTE: If it coincidentally IS the caster's birthday, this ability always succeeds and you do not need to roll for it. If you are not sure whether it’s the caster’s birthday, roll a 1d365. A crit means it's their birthday.

If the target has an anytime action, it can no longer be used by the target for the next minute. Instead, the caster now chooses when and how to use the ability. The ability still costs stamina for the target.

Target must narrate their actions on their next turn like a scheming anime villain’s internal monologue. The longer the speech and the scarier it is, the larger the buff on their next action will be… unless the caster can turn things around by narrating how they’ve actually outwitted them!

Target becomes invested in a really good book and just can’t put it down. Literally. Their eyes must stay glued to the book’s pages nonstop for the next three rounds. They roll disadvantage on any perception checks and drop any other items they are holding.

For the next ten minutes, everything the caster’s lips touch turns to chocolate (except for their own body). This only works on inanimate objects. Things turned to chocolate stay that way for one minute.
For the next hour, all water that the target comes into contact with instantly turns into wine.

All liquids within 100ft of the target, including those in inventories, begin simmering. At the start of the caster’s next turn, they will begin to boil. Touching boiling liquid deals 5 damage per turn. Moving through boiling liquid deals 5 damage per tile. The boiling lasts for 3 minutes. Any part of the liquid that boiled away over the course of this spell is now gone.
All liquids within 100ft of the target instantly freeze. They thaw in 15 minutes.
Every time the target bends a part of their body, there is a snapping noise and they illuminate like a glowstick. Lasts about 8-12 hours and fades over time, like a regular glowstick.

Target is treated like a celebrity for the rest of the day. Everyone acts like they are rich and famous and is inclined to do them favors and give them the VIP treatment. However, fans will randomly mob them, asking them for autographs and generally preventing them from moving or acting.

The target and the caster add their remaining stamina together and divide it in half (rounded down). They now have the exact same amount of stamina. Averaged stamina gained cannot exceed a target’s maximum stamina.

All combatants within 100ft of the target add their remaining stamina together, then divide it by the number of affected targets to find out the average. Each combatant involved splits the stamina pool so they all have equal stamina (rounded down). Averaged stamina gained cannot exceed a target’s maximum stamina.

Whoever currently has the most stamina is hit by a beam from the heavens. Reduce their stamina until it is the lowest of anyone currently conscious on the battlefield. (Does not work on bosses, reroll wild magic instead.)

Target is now wearing a pair of oven mitts that make it hard to pick things up. The oven mitts will not come off until the target bakes something. Attacks using weapons aimed with the hands take a -3 on all attack rolls.

A barbershop quartet of frogs follows the target and sings at them. They will not go away until they are given a nice tip. At the start of each turn they are not given a tip, their singing gets louder and louder, dealing sonic damage. Sonic damage doubles each turn, starting at 2 damage and going from there.

1d4 mice dressed in ballerina attire enter the arena through a hidden door on the nearest flat surface. Each combatant allied with the target must succeed against a DC12 fascinate check or be entranced by the mice’s performance for 1 round per mouse, after which they disappear in a puff of smoke and glitter. Entranced combatants get another chance to reroll to break the fascination each turn.
Target becomes incredibly bothered by the feng shui of the current location. They MUST move a piece of furniture across the room to redecorate before taking any other action.
A long-term illness or body issue ailing the target is permanently cured. If they have no such ailment, they restore 5 stamina.

Target starts dancing and cannot stop. The dancing is infectious and will spread to everyone they touch until 10 minutes have passed or combat ends. Dancing targets lose an ever-increasing amount of stamina at the start of each of their turns. One on the first turn, two on the second, etc.
Target’s arm conceals a built-in laser cannon for the rest of the day. The laser cannon deals 7 damage and has infinite range.
A random chair somewhere in this adventure just got an ejector seat installed.

Summon a chair beneath the target that is so comfy that they can’t help but sit in it. Each turn they stay in the chair they restore 5 stamina. However, all of the target’s allies also want to sit in the chair. The longer someone stays in the chair, the angrier their allies will become.

An adorable cat appears somewhere on the target’s person and falls asleep. They cannot move without disturbing the cat. Morally, they are obligated to stay perfectly still. If they disturb the cat, all of their allies will hate them for ten minutes.
Target attracts every animal within a mile radius for the rest of the day.
Target turns into a frog and will not turn back until they receive a little kiss. (Does not work on bosses, reroll.)
For the rest of the day, any time the target would normally laugh, they instead instantly fall asleep.
The next time the target is pricked by any kind of needle or blade they will instantly fall asleep for 1d6 rounds.

Target’s player must get the caster’s player a snack in real life. If the players are not in the same place (i.e. playing over a voice call), the target’s player has 10 minutes to find an image that will make the caster’s player smile and share it with them. If they fail to do this, the target is knocked out.

Target’s weapon turns into a skateboard and will not turn back until someone performs a sick trick on it. If the target does not have a weapon. THEY turn into a skateboard operating under the same rules. Latter variant does not work on bosses, reroll instead. If one of the players performs said trick, they gain a point of proficiency.

A mosquito suddenly bites the target. Agh! Itchy… At the start of every turn for the rest of the day they must pass a DC2 concentration check. If they fail, they spend their turn scratching the bite. The DC of this check goes up by 1 every time they succeed. It resets upon scratch.

DO NOT READ THIS ALOUD. The GM keeps this effect a secret: Nothing happens. Roll two random dice of your choice, pretend to react to the result, then and do nothing. Once combat ends, start a timer. If the other players forget about this effect and don’t ask what it was within 1 minute of combat’s completion, then all players gain +2 proficiency.

DO NOT READ THIS ALOUD. The GM keeps this effect a secret: Nothing happens. Roll two random dice of your choice, pretend to react to the result, and do nothing. Once combat ends, start a timer. If the other players forget about this effect and don’t ask what it was within 1 minute of combat’s completion, then all players gain +3 stamina.
Target looks exactly how they’ve always wanted to look for the next hour.
The part of the target’s body they are most self conscious about now has a giant arrow pointing to it at all times for the rest of the day.
For the next hour, the caster may treat any spherical object regardless of its material as a bouncy ball, no matter its size. To the caster, these objects have the consistency of a basketball.

For the next hour, the caster may inflate objects by blowing into them like a cartoon inflating their fist before a big punch. The inflation does not need to be done via an orifice, which, for the record, is the worst sentence on this wild magic table.
Caster’s head inflates like a balloon and for ten rounds they can float off the ground. If they hold their breath then they will continue ascending. Every time they talk they deflate and descend.
All foliage within 100ft of the target changes to fall colors.
The area within 50ft of the target advances ahead in time to winter. Only non-sentient objects are affected by this. If it is already winter, advance to summer. Effect ends after 24 hours.

A buff is up for grabs! Whoever gets the buff gains +3 to all rolls and damage output for the next ten minutes. With no discussion or planning, all combatants within 100ft of the target must silently cast a vote on who deserves the buff. Whoever gets the most votes receives the buff. If there is a tie, all those who tied receive the buff.
Target suddenly has an airbag inside of them that will explode out of them the next time they are bumped into, pushed, or attacked.
Target must answer a multiple choice question about the caster correctly or take 3 damage.
Target must answer a multiple choice question about the caster correctly or take 6 damage.
Target must answer a multiple choice question about the caster correctly or take 9 damage.
If the caster can answer a multiple choice question about the target correctly, they earn +1 stamina!
If the caster can answer a multiple choice question about the target correctly, they earn +2 stamina!
If the caster can answer a multiple choice question about the target correctly, they earn +3 stamina!
If the caster can answer a multiple choice question about the target correctly, they earn +1 proficiency!
If the caster can answer a multiple choice question about the target correctly, they earn +3 proficiency!
If the caster can answer a multiple choice question about the target correctly, they earn +5 proficiency!
Target turns into a sentient, talking skeleton for an hour. The skeleton is classified as undead and takes x2 damage from light-based attacks.
A 2x2 iron cage falls on the target. The cage is durable and has 100 health. It cannot be moved. The caster has the key to the cage. (Does not work on bosses, reroll.)
The target lights up like a slot machine and begins to spit out coins and prizes for the next five rounds.
Roll for wild magic again, only this time the target of the spell is reversed: If the spell affects the “target” it now affects the caster and vice versa.
The caster lights up like a slot machine and begins to spit out coins and prizes for the next five rounds.
The target will believe anything that the caster and their allies tell them for the next three rounds, but only if that thing is a lie.
Target hits their funny bone and takes 1 damage. Target cannot use anything in their hands for one round.
Caster permanently gains the ability to speak with the nearest animal. Only that specific animal. Not the whole species. Humans count.
Caster can speak with plants for the rest of the day.
Caster can speak with animals for the rest of the day.
Target’s weapon becomes sentient and speaks for the rest of the day.
Animals follow the target’s commands for the rest of the day.
Target no longer understands how to open a door or window and becomes feral upon interacting with one. Lasts for the rest of the day.
A delivery man appears and gives the target 6 large pizzas that they definitely didn’t order. The delivery man must be paid or he won’t leave.
Target has a jetpack strapped to them that they have no control over.

The caster now has the ability to double jump and damage opponents by bouncing on their heads. They can activate this by passing through an opponent’s square during their movement and using the action mid-move to jump. Jumps deal 8 damage. However, if the caster touches the side of an opponent or anywhere besides the top of their head, they take 5 damage. This ability disappears after two minutes.
For the rest of the day if the caster breaks hollow objects like pots and crates, there is a 1 in 3 chance to find small treasure inside them.
A tree grows from beneath the target’s feet, fully formed. The tree does not go away.
Whatever is going on pauses for the next fifteen minutes while everyone takes a brief snack break. You don’t have to RP this out, but you can if you want to.

No matter where they go, the caster is followed by a dramatic wind that keeps their hair and clothing constantly blowing. Caster rolls advantage on diplomacy and intimidate checks. Effect lasts for an hour.

The target’s eyes are replaced with dragon eyes. Whenever they stare at someone, that person feels an intense air of menace. Target rolls with advantage on intimidation checks for the rest of the day and can inflict fear on their opponents after a successful attack.
Target literally gains eyes in the back of their head for the next hour.
Target now finds ugly things gorgeous and vice versa. Lasts for an hour.
Target begins beeping like a metal detector whenever they approach someone that they think is attractive. Lasts the rest of the day.
Target begins screaming loudly whenever they think someone is lying.
A hidden treasure has been buried somewhere within this adventure, and the caster is absolutely determined to locate it.
It looks to everyone else like the caster has burst into flames and is roasting alive. The caster does not see this. They don’t understand why everybody is screaming. Lasts for ten minutes.
Target transforms into a random mythical creature of the GM’s choice. (May or may not work on bosses. If not, reroll.)
Target has a joy buzzer strapped to their palm and is determined to shake hands at least once. Joy buzzer deals 1 damage.
Target discovered an open grave nearby with their own name written on the tombstone.
Target is on vacation for the next round. They can move and act however they want at zero stamina cost. However, they are not allowed to work! Which means they cannot take or deal any damage.

Target is trying their best to separate work and life. If it is 9am-5pm on a weekday in real life, continue as normal. If not, they are off the clock and refuse to do any more fighting for three rounds. By nature of their managerial position, bosses are always working and therefore this ability does not work on them.

Caster and target are now locked in an eating contest with one another. 1d6 plates of food appear randomly on the battlefield. Caster specifies the food in question. Whoever eats more plates of food is the winner. The loser’s movement is reduced to 5ft per turn. The winner has all of the movement that the loser just lost added to their own movement for ten minutes. In the event that both participants ate the same amount of food, whoever ate that amount first is the winner. Results of the contest last for 10 minutes.
YOU WON’T BELIEVE WHAT THIS DOES! (Target must speak like clickbait until someone either buys something from them or clicks on them.)

A video ad break starts playing over the target. They are locked in time and cannot be accessed by anyone until the ad ends in one round. The caster is the one in the filmed ad. The caster gains +2 stamina for every one of the target’s allies who decide to click the ad or buy the product. The caster’s allies can help with the sales pitch, but they cannot buy the product.

The caster has got the target’s nose. The nose appears in their hand. The nose may be passed freely from person to person. Until the target reclaims their nose, they cannot smell anything and take a -2 to all rolls. This effect lasts until the nose is reclaimed, at which point it pops back on immediately.
Every time the target uses an ability, they transform into a different animal.
Target leaves behind bright, chalky streaks of color on surfaces wherever they walk for the next hour.
Target sinks into the ground up to their waist.
Target becomes convinced they have powerful healing kisses for the rest of the day. They do not.
The target is haunted by disembodied studio audience reaction sounds. Applause, awws, and boos accompany their actions as is appropriate.

DO NOT READ THIS ALOUD: An ominous, disembodied voice asks the caster “Do you feel safe?” If they say no, then they are trapped in a giant 2x2 safe. If they say “yes”, the voice says “Okay~!” and nothing happens. The GM may not explain this ability unless the safe is triggered.

Target is thrown a football. If they can make it to the other side of the arena while holding the football, they score a touchdown then they get 6 points of stamina back and a +2 damage boost for the rest of combat. “The other side of the arena” is defined as the edge furthest from them when the spell is cast.
Target becomes convinced that the floor is lava for the next 10 minutes. They will only walk on elevated surfaces.

Danger! The floor is now lava! The rest of the fight must continue on elevated surfaces! Touching a floor tile deals 10 damage per tile, per round. Everyone automatically appears on top of the nearest elevated object by default. The floor looks normal, but burns you when you touch it. This effect ends when combat ends or after 10 minutes. KO’d participants are no longer burnt by lava if they land in it.

Target is now “It.” At the start of each turn they are “It” they take 6 damage. They must tag someone else to transfer the “It” status. Any adjacent target can be tagged during movement as a free action. Roll to tag. The target may tag anyone, even allies, but no tagbacks. One a combatant has been tagged, they cannot be tagged again. Lasts for ten minutes or until combat ends.

Target is now “It” in a game of Freeze Tag. Any adjacent combatant can be tagged during movement as a free action. Roll to tag. The target may tag anyone, even allies. Anyone touched is instantly frozen solid for three rounds. Non-frozen players can tag frozen allies to thaw them. The same person cannot be frozen a second time once they have been thawed. If the target tags all enemy combatants, they win the game and gain a +3 to all rolls until the end of combat. All frozen targets unfreeze when the game is over.

The caster is now “It” in a game of Freeze Tag. Any adjacent combatant can be tagged during movement as a free action. Roll to tag. The target may tag anyone, even allies. Anyone touched is instantly frozen solid for three rounds. Non-frozen players can tag frozen allies to thaw them. The same person cannot be frozen a second time once they have been thawed. If the target tags all enemy combatants, they win the game and gain a +3 to all rolls until the end of combat. All frozen targets unfreeze when the game is over.

King of Hill! Caster draws a 3x3 area. This is the “Hill”. Whoever ends their turn in the hill gets a +3 to all rolls and damage for the next round. However, only one person can stand on the Hill at a time. If someone else walks onto the Hill they roll opposing dice. The loser is instantly booted out of the Hill.
