Attempting to contest the hill is a standard action.

Target begins a game of hide and seek with the caster and must immediately go hide. The caster’s player must close their eyes. Target immediately teleports to a hiding location of their choice and is no longer visible on the map. If the caster discovers them and tags them, the target instantly takes 10 damage. Once they are found, the game ends. (Does not work on bosses, reroll instead.)

Musical chairs! The target has exactly two rounds to find a chair to sit on. If they are not sitting down when time is up, they lose half their current stamina and fall asleep. They may not sit on the floor or a ledge. Valid seats must be free-standing, such as a bench, a rock, or a stool. Only one person is allowed per chair. Once someone claims a chair, no one else can sit on it. Bosses take 10 damage instead of half max stamina.

Musical chairs! Everyone within 100ft of the target has exactly one round to find a chair to sit on. If a combatant is not sitting down when time is up, they lose half their current stamina and fall asleep. They may not sit on the floor or a ledge. Valid seats must be free-standing, such as a bench, a rock, or a stool. Only one person is allowed per chair. Once someone claims a chair, no one else can sit on it. Bosses take 10 damage instead of half max stamina.

Truth or dare! The target may select “truth” or “dare”. For truth, the caster asks the target a question and they must answer honestly. For dare, caster dares the target to do something and the target must sincerely attempt it. The target may swap between truth and dare, but must go through with one of the two options. If they refuse, they drop to zero stamina. The scope of the dare can be anything that the target would be able to accomplish within 5 minutes.

Simon says! The target must do whatever the caster’s party orders, so long as those orders begin with the words “Simon Says”. If the target does not obey, they take 3 damage. If the order does NOT start with “Simon Says” but the target does the command anyway, they take 3 damage. Each member of the caster’s party may issue one command each as an anytime action. The game lasts until combat ends or all of the caster’s party have issued a command. (Does not work on bosses, reroll instead.)

Red rover! Once during this combat, the caster may say “Red rover, red rover, send [TARGET] right over!” as an anytime action. The target must immediately run towards the caster and try to run past them, no matter what obstacles or dangers are in between them. For every 5ft past their maximum movement range, the target burns 1 point of stamina. It is assumed the target is using a double movement action.

Red light, green light! A red flag and a green flag appear in the caster’s hands. Caster must hold one flag up at all times. When the red flag is up, the target cannot move. When the green flag is up, caster gets a +2 to all rolls. Caster can swap the flags once per round at any time and must swap between the flags at least once every two rounds. If the target can reach the caster and tag them the target gains +5 to all rolls. Game lasts until the target is knocked out or wins. The target may still use abilities while the reg flag as up so long as they do not require movement.

A game of Horseshoes begins as an anytime action. The target is the goalpost. Everyone else rolls a d20. They are compelled to do their best to throw their weapon directly at the target’s face. Each participant gets one chance to throw from where they’re standing. Anyone who hits the target has their weapon instantly teleported back to them and said weapon deals +2 damage for the next 5 rounds. Weapons that do not hit the target remain where they landed. If someone has a projectile weapon like a gun, they must throw the gun itself. The target does not get to play. Target takes a small amount of damage from each weapon that hits them depending on what the weapon is (i.e. a sharp sword deals more damage than a wooden mallet).

If the target has a hidden epithet, they are forced to play a game of twenty questions with the caster. The caster’s party may ask twenty yes/no questions or expend a question to guess the target’s epithet. If someone guesses correctly, they get +2 proficiency in addition to the usual proficiency reward for guessing an epithet. Target must answer honestly. If the target does not have an epithet, reroll wild magic.

Placement markers appear above the heads of the three combatants with the highest stamina, 1st, 2nd, and 3rd. If multiple targets are tied for a placement, reward 1st, 2nd, and 3rd alphabetically based on the names of those who tied. Whenever you succeed on a roll against someone who has a marker, the attacker steals the marker from them. Whoever ends the combat with a marker gets a permanent reward. +3 stamina for 1st place, +2 for 2nd, +1 for 3rd. A combatant may have more than one marker at a time, but only their highest marker counts at the end of the game. If you attack multiple targets at once, steal the highest marker.

Placement markers appear above the heads of the three combatants with the highest stamina, 1st, 2nd, and 3rd. If multiple targets are tied for a placement, reward 1st, 2nd, and 3rd alphabetically based on the names of those who tied. Whenever you succeed on a roll against someone who has a marker, the attacker steals the marker from them. Whoever ends the combat with a marker gets a permanent reward. +3 proficiency for 1st place, +2 for 2nd, +1 for 3rd. A combatant may have more than one marker at a time, but only their highest marker counts at the end of the game. If you attack multiple targets at once, steal the highest marker.

Nose goes! All combatants roll a 1d20 “nose goes” check to see who can touch their nose the fastest. Whoever rolls lowest becomes the new target. (Targets that cannot touch their nose for any reason automatically lose). Roll on the wild magic table again with the loser of “Nose Goes” as the new target.  If two losers tie, they both become the new target. If the original target and the new target are the same person, double the potency of the wild magic.
Confetti falls from the sky for the next ten minutes. Everyone adds +1 to all rolls.

A thunderstorm begins. At the moment the spell is cast and once every round thereafter a lightning bolt will strike the tallest metallic object for 8 electrical damage, such as bats, swords, and armor. If there is no metal on the battlefield, it will instead strike the tallest regular object. This effect occurs even if you are indoors. Lasts for 10 rounds.

A heat wave begins. Scorching sunlight burns all targets for 5 fire damage at the start of their turn. The only way to avoid the heat is to stand in a shaded area. If you are indoors or it is nighttime, electronic lights count as sunshine for the purpose of this spell. Lasts for 10 rounds.

A snowstorm begins and immediately coats the ground. Everyone loses 5ft of movement as they make their way through the snow. However, if you hit an enemy target with a snowball, you steal +5ft of movement from that person. Continue throwing snowballs at your enemies to accumulate as much movement as possible. This buff stacks. Effect occurs even indoors and lasts for 10 rounds.

The arena begins to flood. A foot of water magically floods up from the floor once when the spell is cast and once at the start of the caster’s turn every round thereafter. Once the water touches the ceiling, it disappears. If there is no ceiling, the water only disappears when combat ends.

A creeping fog rolls in. All attacks in the fog have a -2 debuff to their accuracy roll. Somewhere in the fog is a monster. At the start of every round a random person standing in the fog is attacked by the unseen monster for 8 damage. The fog only swirls up to chest height, so if you can get above it somehow, you will be immune to the monster and the debuff. Lasts for 10 minutes.

A meteor shower begins. Each round roll 1d6 meteors. For each meteor, a random 2x2 spot on the map is cast in shadow. The next turn, meteor impacts each of those spots. Targets hit by a meteor take 15 damage. Lasts three rounds or until combat ends.

A small meteor begins closing in on the space where the target is currently standing. It will crash land in 1d4 turns (this will be rolled by the GM and kept secret). The meteor deals 30 damage to the impact square and 15 damage to all adjacent squares, leaving an impact crater.

A large meteor begins closing in on the space where the target is currently standing. It will crash land in 1d4 turns (this will be rolled by the GM and kept secret). The meteor deals 20 damage to all tiles in a 5x5 impact site and 10 to the surrounding two rings of tiles, leaving a large impact crater.

Heavy wind blows across the arena from the caster towards the target at the time of casting. Walking into the wind halves your movement (rounded up). Walking with the wind at your back gives you 2x movement. Lasts for 5 rounds.

A 2x2 tornado appears in the center of the map. The tornado will move 25ft in a random direction determined by 1d8 at the end of each of the caster’s turns: 1 is north, 2 is north east, 3 is east, etc. The tornado sucks up anyone it passes over, spitting them out in a random direction and dealing 7 wind damage. Tornado disappears after five rounds.

Ball lightning appears and begins sparking its way randomly across the field. The ball occupies one square. Anyone adjacent to the ball takes 8 electrical damage. The ball gets two randomized turns on the turn order determined by d20 rolls. On each of its turns the ball will move six spaces in random directions determined by a 6d8 roll, moving 5ft in a random direction for each die. 1 is north, 2 is north east, 3 is east, etc. Ball lasts until combat ends.

A sleet storm begins. The ground is covered in slippery gray mush. Every time a combatant moves they begin sliding in a specific direction until they hit a solid object or another person. A step in the sleet only counts as 5ft of their movement no matter how far they end up sliding, so they may move multiple times through the sleet like a sliding block puzzle. Lasts 3 rounds.

Avalanche warning! All combatants must be quiet! Every time someone makes a loud noise, roll a d20. The source of the noise must beat a DC8, otherwise a 3x3 mound of snow falls from the sky and lands on them, dealing 4 ice damage and trapping them in the snow. Each time someone rolls to see if they trigger snowfall, the DC increases by 2. Effect ends after five avalanche checks.
1d6 random tiles on the current map are now booby-trapped. Whoever steps on it will be hit by venomous arrows for 8 damage and becomes poisoned.
1d20 random tiles on the current map are now booby-trapped. Whoever steps on one of them will be hit by venomous arrows for 8 damage and becomes poisoned.
The ground within 100 ft of the target becomes springy like a trampoline for the next 10 minutes. All furniture within 100ft becomes inflatable and bouncy, like a pool toy or a bounce house.

A wall of electrical energy surrounds the edges of the battlefield and closes in 10ft towards the center of the arena at the top of each round. The storm wall deals 20 damage to anyone who touches it, instantly teleporting them to the center of the arena after they take the damage. The wall only disappears when combat is over.

Summon 1d3 pairs of interconnected portals. Combatants may pass through these portals as if they were adjacent squares. Caster places the first pair of portals, target places the second, and the GM may place the third wherever they think will be “most interesting”.

The arena has transformed into a giant pinball machine. At the top of each round, an invisible Pinball Wizard will shoot a huge 2x2 metal pinball into the arena. The combatants act as bumpers and knock the pinball in random directions whenever it hits them. The Wizard’s goal is to hit as many of you with the pinball as possible to rack up points. The higher the wizard rolls, the more combatants the pinball will bounce off of, dealing 3 damage to each. This effect is dispelled once the pinball is hit into a specified “dead zone”. The “dead zone” is chosen by the GM at the start of this effect and can be anything fitting such as a door, a window, or an actual hole.

The arena is filled to the brim with soap bubbles. All negative status ailments are scrubbed clean. Soap bubbles obscure vision and combatants cannot see further than 25ft away. Bubbles pop away after three rounds.

The eight tiles surrounding the target transform into a moat filled with sharks. Anyone standing in the moat tiles when the spell is cast immediately falls in. The sharks bite anyone who falls in for 8 damage. Sharks deal x2 damage to anyone currently bleeding. The moat tiles remain until combat ends.
Target is attracted to arena hazards and traps and will actively step in every one they see at least once for the rest of the day.

Everywhere within 25ft of the target is covered in a foot and a half of stuffed animals and becomes difficult terrain. Movement is halved while walking through the stuffies. Also, one of the teddy bears is a land mine. This Special Teddy deals 15 damage when triggered.
Every time a combatant ends their turn they automatically are pulled 10ft in the target’s direction.
Every time a combatant ends their turn they automatically are pulled 10ft in the caster’s direction.

The grim reaper arrives, but cannot remember who he’s here for! He can be easily convinced. The reaper will not leave until he takes one target, knocking their stamina to zero (this is not lethal). Alternatively, you can challenge the reaper in a game of chance in order to win a prize. (Does not work on boss fights, reroll instead.)
Caster may draw a barrier in a straight line anywhere they wish on the map up to 50ft in length. This barrier is completely impenetrable for 2 rounds.
Caster begins to taste whatever they are looking at. Lasts for 30 minutes.
For the rest of the day, the caster has the nose of a bloodhound. They can smell absolutely everything and track with their nose.
A giant cartoon salt shaker appears and flavors the target. A second nearby target gains a bib. They are suddenly hungry. What happens next is their choice.

Target begins seeing everyone else as food, as though they have been stuck on a desert island in a cartoon and are dying of hunger. They cannot tell anyone apart. Lasts until the target eats something.
Caster gains the powers of a rubber hose cartoon. They can squash and stretch. Their eyes extend with an A-OOOOGAH. The smell of pie can make them float, etc. Lasts for five rounds.

Target is suddenly tied to a train track extending across the area. If the target is not untied by the time three rounds have passed, they are run over by a cartoon train and immediately have their stamina dropped to zero. (Does not work on boss fights, reroll instead.)

Caster draws cartoon train tracks across the arena. Train tracks must be drawn in a straight line and the target must be standing somewhere on the train tracks. A train will run across the tracks on the start of the caster’s turn in (1d4 - 1) rounds. The train deals 15 damage to anyone standing on the tracks. After the train goes by, roll a (1d4) again and repeat. The tracks disappear when combat ends.

All light sources within 100ft cycle through different colors like a gaming computer. Anyone adjacent to these lights gains a +5 Aura of Gaming. Add +5 to any rolls involving games (video games, tabletop, sports, gambling, etc).

For the next 30 minutes the target cannot use ANY pronouns. They must refer to everyone and everything by their given name. This rule applies to the player/GM controlling them as well. Every ttime their player fails to uphold this rule, they take 5 damage.

For the next 10 minutes the caster’s pronouns are replaced with the rare and powerful “schlee/schler/schlem” pronouns. All other characters and players MUST use these pronouns when referring to the target for the duration of the spell. Each time they fail, their character takes 5 damage.
Target is afflicted with a painful poison that deals 2 damage at the start of their next turn, 3 damage the next turn, 4 damage the next, and so on. The antidote appears in the Caster’s hand.
Targets left and right arms are swapped until they receive a handshake. They roll with a -3 debuff on anything involving hand-eye coordination until then.
Targets arms turn into useless floppy puppet arms until they can successfully teach someone a life lesson. These arms are useless, but amusing.

Curse of Pride. Target becomes obsessed with themselves. They gain a +1 to all rolls… but each time they succeed at something, another number on the d20 becomes a critical failure for them. One success means that 2s are now crit fails. Another success means 3s are now crit fails, etc. This curse continues for ten rounds.
Roll for wild magic again, only this time the target of the spell is reversed: If the spell affects the “target” it now affects the caster and vice versa.
Curse of Envy. Target becomes obsessed with a random weapon or object in another combatant’s possession. The target cannot perform any other action until they take said item from them.

Curse of Gluttony. Target instantly eats any consumable items they have on their person, including harmful ones. If the target sees any other edible items on the field, they will focus on obtaining and eating those items before anything else. Lasts for four rounds.

Curse of Sloth. For the next three rounds, the target must roll a 1d4 at the start of their turn. If they roll a 4, they move normally. If they roll a 3, they lose their movement. If they roll a 2, they lose their action. If they roll a 1, they lose both their movement and action. (Does not work on bosses, reroll instead.)

Curse of Wrath. Target gains +3 to all attack and damage rolls. They are obsessed with hurting whoever most recently wronged them. If nobody has wronged them, they will target the caster. Lasts for three rounds.
Curse of Greed. All of the valuables on the caster’s person are now teleported into the target’s possession. Target refuses to give them back unless they are paid or knocked out.

Curse of Lust. Target can no longer attack the enemy combatant that they find most attractive. If the target does not feel traditional attraction or if their opponents are all minors, the target is instead unable to attack the enemy combatant that they think is the coolest. Lasts until the end of combat or until every other viable target is KO’d.

Buff of Humility. The caster can no longer roll critical hits for the rest of the day, but all their rolls have a +2 buff for the next hour. Treat any nat20s like a 19 instead. Crit damage and stat buffs from 20s are negated.

Buff of Charity. The caster instantly transfers 5 of their own stamina to the target with the lowest percentage of stamina currently on the field. In exchange, the person who received their gift will now listen to whatever they say for the rest of the day.

Buff of Temperance. When in combat, the caster gains a +1 to all rolls for each turn during which they did not attack an opponent. This ability stacks, max +5. This ability lasts for the rest of the day and resets at the end of an encounter.

Buff of Diligence. For each consecutive turn the caster attacks, add an additional +1 damage to the attack. This buff carries over between combats, but resets if the caster ever fails to attack an opponent on any given turn. Ability lasts until the caster falls asleep.
Buff of Patience. For the rest of the day, whenever the caster holds their turn or waits with a prepared action, their next roll gains advantage.
Buff of Kindness. Each time the caster prevents an ally from taking damage, that ally gets a +3 to their next roll. This ability stacks. Lasts the rest of the day.

Buff of Chastity. For the rest of the day, the caster takes 2 less damage from all attacks coming from a foe they think is attractive. If the person attacking them is underaged or if the caster does not feel attraction in the traditional sense, the caster takes reduced damage if the caster thinks that their attacker is cool.
Caster gets the item that they most recently considered buying, but didn’t.
Obtain the target’s phone number. The first time you call them, they have to pick up their phone, no matter what.

A giant spatula appears and flips the target, pressing them against the ground as if it were a grill top. If they remain against the floor, they begin sizzling and take exponential fire damage each turn, starting at 3 damage and increasing by +1 each round thereafter.
A random nearby object expands and pops like a balloon.
A nearby inanimate object shouts “REMEMBER ME!” and then immediately explodes.
A bucket appears. If anyone kicks it, they instantly drop to zero stamina. The bucket disappears after ten minutes.
An old lady wishes to cross the battlefield. Anyone helping her becomes invincible while they are arm-in-arm with the lady. Only two people can help the lady at a time.

Rhythm game curse. Before each of the target’s turns, the caster performs a quick, rhythmic clap pattern with their hands. The clap pattern cannot be longer than 5 seconds. The target must mimic it. If the target gets it right, they may move and act normally. If they fail, they lose either their movement OR their action, caster’s choice. On the plus side, all lights in the vicinity bounce to the target’s rhythm and they have a slight control over all nearby electricity.
Caster and target instantly swap locations.
Caster may teleport the target anywhere they wish within 100ft of the target’s current location. You cannot adjust the target’s elevation by more than 5ft.
The target and one random other target may now teleport to each other at will for the rest of the day.
All combatants randomly switch positions with one another.
The caster may swap every combatant’s position as they see fit. They may only do this once and must do it immediately, if they choose to do it at all.
The caster may freely rearrange anyone on the battlefield to wherever they see fit. They may only do this once and must do it immediately.
Everyone re-rolls initiative. Highest roll goes next.
Reverse the turn order.
The target’s position in the turn order is shifted down two slots. If they are sharing a turn with allies, the allies move with them.
The target’s position in the turn order is shifted down a slot at the start of every round. Any allies sharing their turn are moved with them.
At the end of each of their turns, the caster is moved up one slot in the turn order. If they are sharing a slot in the turn order with their allies, their allies move with them.
Caster may move the target wherever they want on the turn order one time during combat as an anytime action.
Target can only attack the person directly after them in the turn order for the next three rounds. If the target is a boss, this applies to the next PC after them on the turn order.
Target can only attack the person directly before them in the turn order for the next three rounds. If the target is a boss, this applies to the next PC before them on the turn order.
For the remainder of combat, the caster may perform combined actions with enemies. The enemies must do what they say during these actions.
Any consumable items currently on the caster’s person double in potency.
Any consumable items currently on the target’s person double in potency.
An exact copy of any items the target is currently holding in their hand appears. This copy exists permanently.
A disembodied voice shouts “Drop it!” in an authoritative manner. Everyone within earshot drops everything they’re holding.
Target is disarmed. Their weapon goes flying up to 60ft away.
Immediately teleport one item from the target’s possession into the caster’s possession. Caster’s choice. Caster knows everything the target has.
The target may immediately teleport one item in the caster’s possession to the target’s possession. Target’s choice. Target knows everything they have.
Target’s next turn is skipped entirely, but they get to act and move twice the round after that.
Caster gains three actions on their next turn.

Target is convinced that they are a secret crimefighter. They must find a place to hide and quickly change into their costume before doing anything else. If they do not have a costume to transform into, they simply flip their shirt inside out. If anyone sees them doing this, their secret identity is revealed and their attacks deal 2 less damage than normal for the next hour.

Target gains the spell “Hold Person” for the rest of the day. This spell allows them to hold a person. With their arms. So long as the target has their arms wrapped around someone, the person the target is hugging cannot move.
Target is fated to stub their toe real bad some time in the next hour.

Target yells out “I’M GONNA DO A FLIP!!!” Due to social obligation, the target must now successfully perform a flip. Each turn they fail to perform a fip, everyone is disappointed and they take 5 shame damage.
Target randomly begins sneezing out random items at the start of each round. This effect only ends when they can successfully sell one. Items given away for free don’t count.
Target is convinced that they are a world-renowned martial artist and their body is a deadly weapon. Effect lasts for three rounds.

Prisoner’s Dilemma: The caster and the target are sent to a pocket dimension where both of them are given two buttons, a green one and a red one. If they both push the green button, they are healed for 5 stamina. If they both push the red button, they are electrocuted for 6 damage. If one of them pushes the green button and the other pushes the red, the one who pushed the green will be zapped for 12 damage. The two can speak to each other before they make their vote. After the vote, they are teleported back to where they were before.

Target’s facade falls apart to reveal they are actually two children in an overcoat. Each child has the stats and personality of their adult counterpart, but the target’s stamina is split evenly between the two. Both children move and operate independently on the same turn. This effect is undone in three rounds, when the children will reconvene wherever the “Legs” child is standing. If the target is already a child, they are instead revealed to be two adults in an overcoat.

The bottom of the target’s pants/dress/skirt/etc begins growing in length at a length of 1ft at the start of each of their turns. Once the fabric extends beyond the target’s ankles, they must roll a balance check to see if they trip whenever they move. Effect does not end until the cloth extends 3ft beyond their toes or combat ends. Clothes stay elongated even after the effect ends.
Target is suddenly wearing a wedding dress.
Target is suddenly dressed as a clown.
Target is suddenly wearing a full-body dinosaur costume.
Target now has the tail and ears of their favorite animal for the rest of the day.

Caster is suddenly wearing a classic blue cone hat wizard outfit, complete with fake beard. Magical damage is buffed by +3 so long as the target wears the outfit. The outfit’s enchantment wears off at the end of the day.

Target is suddenly wearing a bedsheet that makes them look like a ghost. So long as they are wearing this sheet, everyone around them is absolutely terrified of them. The sheet disappears after 5 rounds. They can take it off.
Target is now wearing a full suit of armor. +3 damage reduction on all physical attacks, but -15ft of movement. It takes a full 10 minutes to remove the armor without help.

Target is now in a full astronaut suit. It’s surprisingly heavy, but resistant to cosmic radiation. -10ft of movement, but +5 damage reduction from all incoming magical attacks. It takes a full 10 minutes to remove the suit.

Target is suddenly wearing a top hat and cape and temporarily gains the powers of a really good magician. They can pull a rabbit out of a hat, handkerchief chains from their sleeves, cut someone in half (so long as they are in a box), etc. This effect lasts for as long as their current audience stays impressed with you. Once they are no longer impressed, the spell breaks.
Caster gains 5 points of armor. The armor blocks up to five points of damage, but cannot be expended to use abilities. The caster may choose when to use the armor to absorb an attack.
Target gains 3 points of armor. The armor blocks up to three points of damage, but cannot be expended to use abilities. The target may choose when to use the armor to absorb an attack.
Same as the above, but the armor is worth 6 points of damage.
Same as the above, but the armor is worth 9 points of damage.
Caster gains the ability to turn their skin to metal for one hour.
Caster can now eat anything as though it is a soft cookie for the next hour.
Target forgets how to sit down for the next five hours.
Target forgets how to walk and must use other forms of movement for the next ten minutes.
Target becomes magnetized. All metal objects within 15ft are attracted to them. Effect lasts until the next time they fall asleep.

Target becomes rollable, like a katamari ball. Any time they are rolled into another object or person, that object or person is stuck to them like glue. The ball continues growing in size for each object attached to them. Only one person at a time is allowed to roll the Target around without getting stuck themselves. This person is specified by the caster and may be changed at any time on the caster’s turn. Anyone caught in the ball may act on their turn, but they can only move as well as someone stuck to whatever they’re stuck to would be able to move. Effect lasts for five rounds.
Caster’s voice drops an octave and sounds like a professional movie announcer for the next twenty minutes.
Caster gains telekinesis for one hour. Range 150ft. They cannot pick up anything that they wouldn’t be able to carry normally.
For the rest of the day whenever the caster is at full stamina, they may shoot beams out of their arms by doing karate chops. The beams travel up to 20ft and deal 4 light damage.
Target gains exponential stamina regeneration at the start of each turn. 1 stamina on the first turn, 2 on the second, 3 on the third, etc. This effect ends after five rounds.
Target now needs glasses and has a -4 to all rolls involving vision and aiming. If the target already had glasses, they no longer need glasses. This effect is undone the next time the target sleeps.
Caster has X-Ray vision and can now see through walls and other solid objects up to 10ft thick. Lasts for the next hour.
Caster receives night vision for 24 hours.
Caster can hear the thoughts of anyone standing within 10ft of them for the next half hour.
Caster can shoot lasers from their eyes for the next 10 minutes. Lasers deal 3 damage and have infinite range. Lasers only miss on a nat1 or if the enemy is holding something reflective.

Caster gains literal finger guns. They may shoot bullets of force dealing 3 damage at 25ft. Each bullet costs one point of stamina. To fire the bullet, they must point their finger like a gun and say “PEW!” out loud. Lasts for the rest of the day.
Caster can now slice their arms through the air to fire slicing gusts of wind at enemies. The gusts deal wind 4 damage and have a range of 15ft. Lasts for the rest of the day.

Caster gains the power to energy drink blasts for the rest of the day. Multicolored, electrolyte-filled liquid can be thrown at targets at a distance of 25ft. Each blast deals 5 water damage, but energizes enemy targets and gives them +10ft of movement on their next turn.
Caster can automatically detect epithet users within 30ft until next rest.
Target now rolls the physically improbable d21 instead of a d20 until the end of combat.
Caster now rolls the physically improbable d21 instead of a d20 until the end of combat.
Everyone now rolls the physically improbable d21 instead of a d20 until the end of combat.

Look at the target’s character sheet. Replace up to 3 words on it with the word “snakes”. Their abilities will change as appropriate. Lasts until the end of combat. If the character sheet is private, the GM will select the words to the caster’s benefit.

The target looks at the caster’s character sheet. They can replace up to 3 words on it with the word “snakes”. Their abilities will change as appropriate. Lasts until the end of combat. If the character sheet is private, the GM will select the words to the target’s.
Target is now sopping wet.
For the next hour, the target can create a pair of portals on any flat surface in their line of sight and teleport between them as though the entrances are adjacent.

For the next hour, every time the target tries speaking in a conversation someone else immediately begins talking over them. The other players must speak over them every time they begin talking. If the target ever gets a word in edgewise, they get +2 to all rolls for the next round. Target can only attempt to speak twice per round. Resets every round. Lasts for three rounds.
Steam shoots out of the target’s ears as if they are extremely angry. Anyone adjacent to them is burned for 5 fire damage.

Target’s mouth is suddenly filled with a spicy sensation. For the next minute, they can spit fire up to 10ft away. Deals 6 fire damage to enemies and 2 points of fire damage to the user each time they use this.
Target forms an empathic link with the caster. They will always mirror the emotion the caster is presenting. Even if the caster is faking it the Target will feel the emotion sincerely.

Target becomes a lightning rod for weapons. All ranged attacks magically change course mid-flight in order to aim at the target instead. Lasts until the target is KO’d or until combat ends. Melee weapons are unaffected.

It’s a tea party! Everyone on the field of battle now has a cup of tea. Your tea represents your stamina. If you spill half of it, you lose half your health, etc. If your teacup is empty, you are knocked out. Tea party ends when combat ends, or if all tea party participants collectively (and respectfully) elect to end it.
Roll for wild magic again, only this time the target of the spell is reversed: If the spell affects the “target” it now affects the caster and vice versa.

Target is completely pacified and has absolutely zero interest in fighting. If anyone else is fighting, the target is determined to get everyone else to stop. Does not work if the target is the only enemy in the encounter or if they are a boss. In these cases, reroll the spell.
Target is encased in the center of a 15ft cube of water. Cube lasts for 10 minutes.
Target is teleported 3d10 feet in the air.
For the next hour the target's weapon is now made entirely of candy.
Any undead within 1000ft of the target burst into flame, taking 15 damage.
For the rest of the day, the caster has actual mime magic. They can pantomime invisible walls, objects, and weapons. The quality of the weapon depends on the believability of their pantomime.

For the rest of the day, the caster becomes a smellblade, which is like a spellblade except you can imbue elemental damage into objects with smells. If you rub something with a “cold” scent like mint or aloe, it bestows ice damage. If you rub something with a “warm” scent like cinnamon or paprika, it bestows fire damage. Smells must be sourced from nearby things. The player may propose any smell buff and it’s up to the GM what said smell does.

For the rest of the day, the caster can now eat magic as though it were harmless candy. Each different type of elemental spell has a different flavor. Spells still harm the target unless they land in their mouth.

For the next five rounds, the target must shout out all of their attacks and plans before enacting them, making it drastically easy for others to avoid them. However, if the attack lands, it deals 1.5x damage.

All combatants on the field act simultaneously for the next round. Everyone simultaneously writes down what they would do right now at this very moment (as if they do not know that this wild magic is in effect). Once everyone has written their intentions down, the GM will privately read all of the actions and resolve them simultaneously. Actions begin at the same moment and all go off at once. The order in which actions resolve is up to the GM. All movement happens at the same time.
For the rest of the day, the target cannot speak unless their hair is wet.

For the next ten minutes, anyone the target attacks with their base weapon appears to the target as if they have been knocked out, but in actuality they turn invisible to the target for three rounds. Invisibility is dispelled when attacking. Invisible targets deal x2 sneak attack damage.
Look at the calendar. What day of the month is it? Target takes 1/3rd that many points of damage, rounded up.
Look at the calendar. What month of the year is it? An ally of the caster’s choice heals that many points of stamina.

Target turns into a stuffed animal that operates by Toy Story rules. Any time a human can see them, they instantly ragdoll onto the floor and cannot move. Lasts for three rounds, or until somebody hugs them. (Does not work on bosses, reroll instead.)
For the rest of the day, the target will automatically catch anything thrown at them. On a DC12 they may harmlessly catch high-speed projectiles such as bullets.

Roll a d12+2. For the next two turns, the target has an AC (armor class) of the number that was just rolled. All rolls of that number or higher automatically hit, all rolls below that number automatically miss.
Roll a d12+5. For the next two turns, the caster has an AC (armor class) of the number that was just rolled. All rolls of that number or higher hit, all rolls below that number miss.

Phantom marionette strings extend up from the target’s limbs and disappear a few feet above them. The target moves and acts normally, but if someone cuts the string above one of their limbs or head, that part of the target’s body goes limp and they cannot move it. Lasts ten rounds or until all of the strings are cut.

Every time the target walks, their body stretches and contracts as they move up and down, making a noise like an accordion. Their base attack now deals sonic damage, but they look ridiculous. Lasts five rounds.

Target begins rapidly drying out like a raisin. With each turn they get more and more wrinkly and lose 5ft of movement. Every time they drink any liquid, they reset to normal. Effect lasts for five rounds.
Target can now be picked up and thrown as though they are a five pound object. Lasts for 30 minutes.
Everybody within 100ft of the target can now be picked up and thrown as though they are a five pound object. Lasts until the end of combat.
Target is now as light as a feather and can be blown away by a slight breeze for the next five rounds.
Target is now classified as undead. They do not look undead, smell undead, or have any other properties typically associated with the undead. But they know. This effect does not go away.
A man appears with a briefcase and hands it to the target, saying “You have to hide this! They’re after me!” and runs. The GM decides what, if anything, is inside of the briefcase.
Target is now guaranteed to have a good week.
Target gets a call from their parents/guardian telling them that they love them.
Someone the target loves has a good day.
The next time that the target feels depressed, their depression is completely erased and they have a great day instead.

Target now has a pair of tight, poorly-made headphones on their head that deal 1d4 damage every turn they are worn. If they take the headphones off, they cannot hear anyone else and are deafened. This effect lasts for 3 minutes.

The target is thrown in the direction of the nearest wall. They slam against the wall and take 6 damage. If there are no walls in the area, the target will be thrown towards the nearest person instead, who also takes the damage.
The target is thrown 50ft north. Any adjacent targets who they pass by may take a free swing at them with their weapon, even if it is not their turn.
The target is thrown 50ft east. Any adjacent targets who they pass by may take a free swing at them with their weapon, even if it is not their turn.
The target is thrown 50ft south. Any adjacent targets who they pass by may take a free swing at them with their weapon, even if it is not their turn.
The target is thrown 50ft west. Any adjacent targets who they pass by may take a free swing at them with their weapon, even if it is not their turn.

Target is now speedrunning. They move with double speed, but only if they’re moving in the most optimal way possible for whatever game they’re currently speedrunning (i.e. constantly rolling everywhere, jumping backwards, backflipping, etc). Lasts 5 rounds. However, if the target cannot defeat a foe every 3 rounds, they won’t be able to make the world record time and the run will end, causing their stamina to drop to zero. Does not work on bosses.

Caster is now speedrunning. They move with double speed, but only if they’re moving in the most optimal way possible for whatever game they’re currently speedrunning (i.e. constantly rolling everywhere, jumping backwards, backflipping, etc). Lasts 5 rounds. Lasts 5 rounds. However, if their party cannot defeat a foe every 3 rounds, they won’t be able to make the world record time and the run will end, causing their stamina to drop to zero.
The area 250ft around the target is immediately abandoned and a halloween store moves in to sell its wares.
Target’s mouth is suddenly full of peanut butter.

Every time the target swears, they must put a dollar in the swear jar. The swear jar appears dead center in whatever room they are currently in when they swear. They must physically walk over and put the dollar in the swear jar before doing anything else.
Target is hit by a cream pie from somewhere unknown and blinded.
Target’s worst fear is summoned. Dissipates after 10 minutes or if the target overcomes their fear.
For the next 5 rounds, the target turns into a liquid version of themselves. They are wrapped in a thin, plastic, person-shaped coating. If popped, they will spill.

Target rolls a random word and keeps it secret. Target cannot speak again until they successfully convey the word to someone else through charades and pantomime. Their player may narrate their physical actions as per usual, but they may not use the word to do so. If the game is in person, the player must actually do the charades.

Target is now wearing magic sneakers. The sneakers move on their own 15ft in a random direction at the end of each of the target’s turns. The direction they move is determined by a 1d8. 1 is north, 2 is north east, 3 is east, etc.

Everyone is now wearing magic sneakers. The sneakers move on their own 15ft in a random direction at the end of each wearer’s turn. The direction they move is determined by a 1d8. 1 is north, 2 is north east, 3 is east, etc.
Target gets an extra move action this round.
Target can move up to 500ft on their next turn.

Target is compelled to endlessly move towards a person of the caster’s choice at a leisurely pace. They cannot double move. They cannot go any other direction. They MUST move towards the assigned target. Lasts 5 rounds.
Target cannot double move for the rest of the combat.
For the next hour, everyone within 100ft of the target looks exactly the same to them. Their voices sound identical and they cannot tell anyone apart. The caster decides what everybody looks like.
For the next five minutes, the target is immune to physical damage… but EXTREMELY weak to insults.
For the next five minutes, the target is immune to ranged attacks… but EXTREMELY weak to insults.
For the next five minutes, the target is immune to epithets and magic… but EXTREMELY weak to insults.
Target gains an aura that reflects all physical damage taken back at the source for two rounds.
Target gains an aura that reflects all magical damage taken back at the source for three rounds.
Caster gains an aura that reflects all physical damage taken back at the source for two rounds.
Caster gains an aura that reflects all magical damage taken back at the source for three rounds.

Target turns into a snowman. Target can speak and move at 1/3rd of their regular movement speed. The target takes double damage from fire attacks and can melt. Spell lasts for three rounds or until they are given a hat.
Something nearby falls over, revealing itself to be a painted movie set piece.
Target is hit by a cartoon boxing glove for 4 damage and cartoonishly flies into the distance.
Beautiful flowers grow wherever the target walks for the next 2 hours.
Any metal that comes into contact with the caster begins corroding and rusts away. This effect lasts until the next time the target sleeps.
A 2x2 bottomless pit appears in a random square adjacent to the caster at the end of each of their turns. Anyone who falls into the pit takes 8 damage, then teleports back to the surface.
Caster finds an object of ancient evil that whispers dark temptations, but no one can take the object seriously.
Target becomes wide. They now occupy a 1x2 space on the battle map for the next two rounds.
Target becomes extra wide. They now occupy a 1x4 space on the battle map for the next two rounds.
A plate of the target’s favorite food appears in their hand.
Target gets ripped. Like, SUPER buff. Buffness lasts for the rest of the day.
Target gets ripped. Like a piece of paper ripped in half. Being torn in half is harmless, but annoying. Your halves may blow away in the wind. Lasts for 10 minutes.
Target becomes a drawing and can only walk along walls, floors, and other 2D spaces. Effect ends after 10 minutes or when someone adds shading to the target.

Target gains the powers of a piece of paper for the next hour. They can be folded into various origami shapes, slide through paper thin cracks, etc. Unarmed strikes inflict paper cuts on rolls of 15 or higher. Targets with paper cuts suffer 3 bleed damage at the start of every turn.

For the rest of the day, the target can heal others by hugging them and complimenting them. Lasts ten minutes. Amount healed is based on the quality of the compliments and hug, max 5 stamina per target.

For the rest of the day, the caster can heal others by hugging them and complimenting them. Lasts ten minutes. Amount healed is based on the quality of the compliments and hug, max 5 stamina per target.

Target is instantly attached to another target of the caster’s choice and teleports adjacent to them. Whenever one target moves, both targets move together. Only movement is mirrored, not actions. Lasts for three rounds.

The target and the nearest person are teleported into a single oversized t-shirt that reads “GET ALONG SHIRT”. Their legs are tied together. Until they are separated, they can ONLY use combined actions with each other. No other actions are allowed. They may not separate themselves, but others can separate them.

The caster and the nearest person are teleported into a single oversized t-shirt that reads “GET ALONG SHIRT”. Their legs are tied together. Until they are separated, they can ONLY use combined actions with each other. No other actions are allowed. They may not separate themselves, but others can separate them.

Same hat! The caster and the target are now wearing identical hats (caster’s choice of design). Whoever is wearing these hat cannot be damaged by their fellow hat wearer under any circumstances. The hats may be freely transferred, but only if another combatant volunteers to begin wearing one of them. Hats must always be on someone’s head. Enchantment lasts for ten minutes, afterwards they become normal hats.

Pick a second target of your choice in addition to your first target. When one target moves, the other one moves the same amount of spaces in the exact same direction, even if it is not their turn. The targets can take damage if their partner smashes them into a wall or a hazard.
Caster and target are now soulbound. When one of them expends stamina to use an ability, the other loses the same amount of stamina.

Caster picks a second target in addition to the person they chose to aim this spell at. These two targets are now soulbound. When one of them loses or gains stamina for any reason, the other does the same.
For the next hour, whenever the caster is afflicted by a status ailment or buff, the target gains the same affliction.
Caster is now powered by how stylish their attacks are. For each extra pose or move they put on top of an attack, they get +2 to the roll.

The ghost of a legendary expert of whatever the target is proficient in appears to silently critique them from behind. If they are impressed by the target within the next five minutes, the target heals +5 stamina. If a player helps them out with this, said player gains +1 proficiency. Make sure the ghost doesn’t think you’re doing it for selfish reasons, though!

Fashion show! The target looks at everyone’s outfit and must honestly rank them worst to best. The bottom three take BAD TASTE DAMAGE. 3 damage for 3rd worst, 6 damage for 2nd worst, 9 damage for worst overall. The most stylish fashionista in the room gets +1 proficiency.
Target gains an onion and immediately eats it. They begin crying.
A pinecone appears in the target’s hand and they cannot move until they eat the entire thing.

The target’s stamina bar explodes. Immediately drop their stamina to zero and knock them out. However much stamina they had left turns into AOE damage. So, for instance, if they had 20 stamina left when this spell hit them, deal 20 damage to anyone standing adjacent to the target. This effect only works on 33% of a boss’s remaining health bar.
Change one letter of the target’s Epithet to morph it to another word for the next ten minutes. If the Epithet is private, the GM must do this. If they don’t have an epithet, reroll.

For the next hour, 1d3 of the target’s abilities are revealed and the caster add, remove, or substitute a letter from each. EX: “Hold person” becomes “Fold person”. “Ice Storm” becomes “Rice Storm”. The caster’s allies may help rename the abilities.
An embarrassing body pillow appears in the target’s arms. It is not lewd, but the character chosen for the pillow is… baffling.
For the next three rounds the target’s weapon can hit anyone from anywhere, regardless of distance.
Caster and target swap base weapons.
Everyone within 50ft of the caster randomly swaps weapons.

Target will only take 1 damage on the next attack, no matter what. Then 2 damage. Then 4 damage. Then 8, 16, 32, etc. It doesn’t matter how much damage an attack is supposed to do, the amount they take doubles every time. Multi-part attacks count as more than one hit. Lasts until they are knocked out or fall asleep. Does not work on bosses.
If the target is defeated, they will do whatever the person who lands the last blow on them says for the rest of the day without question.

The target’s head pops off harmlessly and rolls away. A glowing, colored flame emerges from their neck. For the next ten minutes, the target is a dullahan. They are classified as undead and their damage type changes to darkness damage. They do not need their head to see, but they feel uncomfortable without it.
Target transforms into a sentient vehicle of the caster’s choice for 3 rounds.
Roll for wild magic again, only this time the target of the spell is reversed: If the spell affects the “target” it now affects the caster and vice versa.

Target is now riding atop a mechanical bull. They move as normal, but they must succeed a DC10 dexterity check at the start of each turn to see if they can stay on the bull. For each turn they stay on the bull, +1 bonus to all rolls. The DC to stay on the bull increases by 1 each round. This bonus stacks upon successful rolls. However, if the target falls off the bull, the effect ends and they are afflicted with the Rodeo Shame debuff and have -3 to all rolls for three rounds.

Target is now rapidly running out of batteries. They only have 3 rounds left before they are KO’d unless they are charged. A cord appears on their backside like a tail. The cord must be plugged into an electrical source to charge them. If no electrical sources are nearby, 1d3 magical outlets appear within 100ft.

Target gains a huge stack of 1d12 ice cream scoops on a cone. Keeping the scoops from falling is now their number one priority. Each scoop that falls deals 2 damage to their very soul. The target may spend their action to eat up to two scoops. Roll for each scoop eaten. The target must pass a Brain Freeze Check, otherwise they are frozen. The Brain Freeze DC is DC[(Scoops eaten in total) +5]

Target is now animated, but they are constantly running out of animation budget and have to find inconspicuous ways to save money, otherwise they will not be able to move (i.e. fog covering them, darkness, teleporting, etc.). Lasts for five rounds.
For the next 10 minutes, any damage dealt to the caster is also dealt to anybody the caster is touching. This can chain across multiple targets.
Mundie power! Any time the caster is rolling for something that does not require the use of an epithet, add +3 to the roll for the next ten minutes.
Inscribed power! Any time the caster is rolling for something requiring the use of their epithet, add +3 to their roll for the next ten minutes.
Buff a friend! The target may choose one ally. This ally gets a +2 buff to all rolls for the next hour. If the target has no allies, a two-inch tall fairy appears and becomes their friend.

Each time the caster avoids an attack, time slows down a little for them and they get a little better at dodging. Every time they dodge an attack, all subsequent attack rolls against them take an additional -1 penalty. This stacks up to -5. A nat 20 is still a crit. Effect lasts for fifteen minutes in-universe.

Each time the target avoids an attack, time slows down a little for them and they get a little better at dodging. Every time they dodge an attack, all subsequent attack rolls against them take an additional -1 penalty. This stacks up to -5. A nat 20 is still a crit. Effect lasts for fifteen minutes in-universe.
Caster cannot take fall damage for the rest of the day, no matter the height.
Caster is an extremophile for the rest of the day. They can withstand any temperature, blazing hot or freezing cold with no issue.

Target receives an important phone call from their boss, a celebrity, or a person that they just can’t ignore. They must answer the phone call and complete it while acting like everything is normal. If the person on the end of the line ever hangs up in frustration, the target takes a -3 debuff on all rolls for the next hour.
Target’s weak point starts glowing.

The target and the caster are locked in a duel for the next three rounds. They can only damage each other. They are invincible to damage from all other sources. Duel ends when one of them is knocked out. The duel can be ended early if one of the targets is shot with a gun or slapped across the face with a glove.

For the next ten minutes, anyone that the caster slaps will be forced to duel them. Slapped targets can only attack the person who slapped them. Effect is dispelled when one of the duelists is KO’d or when both targets agree to end the duel.
Copy-paste combo spell. For the next ten minutes, the caster has the ability to create an exact copy of any object, but only if the target is touching it. The copies are permanent.

Caster gains the ability to pick up one object that can not usually be picked up, such as a hole or lifting a window off of a wall like it’s a painting. The caster may pick up and move the object of their choice exactly one time before this ability vanishes.
For the rest of the day, the caster cannot lose at rock-paper-scissors.
The next time the caster points their finger, everyone who can see the caster must look in the direction that they pointed. This single point is considered an anytime action.
Target can only turn clockwise for the rest of the day. If they want to turn to the left, they instead have to rotate 270 degrees to the right.

Target gains one additional use of an ability that is normally once-per-round, once-per-combat, OR once-per-session. They may keep this additional usage at the ready indefinitely, but it can only be used once.

Caster gains one additional use of an ability that is normally once-per-round, once-per-combat, OR once-per-session. They may keep this additional usage at the ready indefinitely, but it can only be used once.
Caster instantly absorbs 3 stamina from the target.
Caster instantly absorbs 6 stamina from the target.
Caster instantly absorbs 9 stamina from the target.
Caster’s weapon now restores 1/3rd of the damage done to enemy targets as stamina. Lasts for the rest of the day.
When the target's stamina is reduced below 50% they turn red and enter their “second phase”. Their movement speed increases by 1.5x (rounded up) and they add +2 to all rolls and damage.

Text adventure curse. For the next hour, the target can only interact with things as though they are typing commands in an old-school text adventure, ex: “Use SWORD on BOB”. “CLIMB STAIRS”. “GET YE FLASK”. They must say the command out loud. They do not have to roll for any actions. Instead, they must phrase things exactly right, otherwise the GM will not understand them. For example, “PICK UP ROPE” may do nothing, but “GET ROPE” would be a success. Not every action will succeed automatically, only ones that make sense. Target gets three attempts per round, but only one standard action. Once they input an action that succeeds, they can’t submit more.
If the target is lined up directly adjacent to two of their allies, all three of them will instantly be KO’d like a line of disappearing blocks in a puzzle game.

Target is reduced to a chess pawn. They can now only move 5ft per round. However, if they reach any edge of the arena, they are upgraded to a queen and gain a massive buff: +7 to all rolls, +5 to damage, and they can move an infinite number of spaces so long as they travel in a straight line. Effect lasts until the end of combat. As a pawn the target cannot use any movement abilities, but they may be moved by other combatants. (Does not work on bosses, reroll instead.)
For the next five rounds, the target can only move on diagonals, each of which costs 7.5ft of movement.
Caster steals 10ft of the target’s movement speed for the next ten minutes.

Caster may booby trap one element of the target’s character sheet: Whenever the target uses their specified ability, weapon, or passive, they take 3 damage. If the caster doesn’t know which ability is which, they can specify “first ability on sheet”, “second”, etc. The target does not know about the trap in-universe. Lasts until the end of combat or the bomb is activated three times.

Target may booby trap one element of the caster’s character sheet: Whenever the target uses their specified ability, weapon, or passive, the caster takes 3 damage. If the target doesn’t know which ability is which, they can specify “first ability on sheet”, “second”, etc. The target does not know about the trap in-universe. Lasts until the end of combat or the bomb is activated three times.
For the next 10 minutes, the caster may use the ability that the target last used. If the target has not used an ability, take their passive instead.
The caster may copy one of the target’s abilities of their choice for the next ten minutes. Caster gets to see all the options before they pick.
Target cannot use the first ability on their character sheet for three rounds.
Target cannot use the second ability on their character sheet for three rounds. If they have only one ability, they cannot use that instead.
Target cannot use the third ability on their character sheet for three rounds. If they have only two abilities or less, disable the second one.
Target’s passives are disabled for ten rounds. The GM has the right to veto this if it completely ruins an encounter. If vetoed, reroll.
The target’s abilities cost x2 stamina for the next two rounds.
The caster’s abilities cost x2 stamina for the next two rounds.
The target’s base weapon now costs 1 stamina per usage. Lasts for 4 rounds.
Target rolls a d10 instead of a d20 for their next two actions. Success rate is still determined as if they had the full 1-20 range to work with.
For this round, every single attack aimed at the target hits them regardless of the roll so long as the attacker does not roll a 1.
Target’s allies are now immune to friendly fire for the duration of combat.
Caster’s allies are now immune to friendly fire for the duration of combat.
Target’s stamina instantly drops to 1. (Does not work on bosses or mini-bosses, reroll instead.)
Target restores 3 stamina.
Target restores 6 stamina.
Target restores 9 stamina.
Target’s stamina recovers to full. (Does not work on bosses, reroll instead.)
The next time the target’s stamina hits zero, they will instantly be revived and gain 50% of their stamina back. (Does not work on bosses, reroll instead.)
Caster’s stamina instantly drops to 1.
Caster restores 3 stamina.
Caster restores 6 stamina.
Caster restores 9 stamina.
Caster’s stamina recovers to full.
The next time the caster’s stamina hits zero, they will instantly be revived and gain 50% of their stamina back.
For the next two rounds, the target gains stamina instead of losing it whenever they use abilities. They still take damage as normal.
For the next two rounds, the caster gains stamina instead of losing it whenever they use abilities. They still take damage as normal.
Magic spells cost the caster no stamina or magical ammo for 5 rounds.
Caster suddenly knows the location of the nearest collectible item, if your campaign has them. If not, reroll.
For the next five hours, the caster beeps whenever they are within 30ft of a hidden collectible or secret somewhere nearby on the map.
For the remainder of combat, reduce the cost of one of your abilities by 1. Note that this does not work on abilities that already cost 1 stamina.
Caster’s current weapon gets an upgrade! Permanently add +2 base damage.
Caster’s current weapon gets an upgrade. Add +1 to all attack rolls.
Caster’s current weapon gets an upgrade! Add +5ft to the weapon’s range.
Caster’s current weapon gets an upgrade! The weapon may now inflict a relevant status effect. If it already inflicts a status effect, increase the potency.
Caster permanently gains +5ft Movement!
Caster permanently gains 1 stamina!
Caster gains +1 proficiency!
Caster gains +1 companionship points to spend with whoever they like!
Caster permanently gains +3 stamina!
Caster gains +2 proficiency!
Caster gains +2 companionship points to spend with whoever they like!
Caster permanently gains +5 stamina!
Caster gains +3 proficiency!
Caster gains +3 companionship points to spend with whoever they like!
Caster’s party all gain +1 stamina.
Caster’s party all gain +1 proficiency.
Caster’s party all gain +1 companionship.
Caster may upgrade any ability or weapon of their choice one time at no cost.
Caster gets a new ability! The GM can make up this new ability at their leisure but should try and give it to the player before the next play session.

Something previously unknown to the players from within the GM’s notes about the current situation is suddenly revealed to all players. If the players already discovered everything about the surrounding map and characters, then they all get +2 proficiency for being so smart.
Target rolls a random word and gains a new epithet they can use for the next five minutes.
One-Time Wild Magic Buff: Next time you roll a spell, you may choose to increase the damage output by 1.5x. Must be done before the spell is rolled.
One-Time Wild Magic Buff: Next time you roll a spell that harms you or an ally, reduce the negative effect by 50%.
One-Time Wild Magic Buff: After rolling a spell, you may choose to check the adjacent spells (EX: if you roll 500, check 499 and 501). If you wish, you may choose to use one of those spells instead.
One-Time Wild Magic Buff: Next time you roll a spell, you may change a single word in the spell’s description to another word of your choice. You have 1 minute after the spell is rolled to do this.
One-Time Wild Magic Buff: Next time you roll a wild magic spell, you may roll twice and pick your preferred of the two options.
One-Time Wild Magic Buff: Next time you roll a wild magic spell, you may swap the word “Target” to “Caster” or vice versa.
Inspired Wild Magic. Roll the 1d1000 again twice and select two new spells. The caster gets to pick which of the two occurs.
Double Trouble. Select an additional target and reroll wild magic. The spell hits both of the selected targets. You may not select the same target twice.
Wild Magic Overdrive. Roll 3 more times and all 3 effects hit random targets.

Pick your poison. Caster names a number from 1 to 1000. The spell selected takes effect immediately. Caster may not look at the wild magic sheet or any notes they have written about wild magic when selecting their number.
Pick your poison. Caster has 30 seconds to look at the wild magic sheet and pick any single ability they want. The countdown starts the moment their eyes hit the list. The GM should man the timer.
Caster becomes completely invincible for three rounds. Any target that they touch takes 8 pure magic damage. +2 to all rolls.

Wild Master. Make up a spell right now on the spot. It can be anything you want so long as it meets the following criteria: The spell is non-lethal, non-permanent, changes the combat in an interesting way, and is silly. You have 3 minutes to make up a spell, starting now. Go. After the combat, you may choose to add a version this spell as a regular ability on your character sheet. The GM will decide if this is allowed and, if so, how much stamina it costs.
